excerpts: But previously I've gotten the shrimp burrito special, and a classic carne asada burrito.
All of which made me forget about how frustrating it was to scramble cash bills.
This is a Mission staple and I will one hundred percent be returning.
burrito.author: Navila H.
burrito.review:
CASH ONLY

A wonderful taqueria in the heart of the Mission. It's cash only and from my experience these are the places in San Francisco that know they are not losing business by being so. 

They're recently remodeled! There's now bright yellow walls and colorful traditional flags lining the ceiling. There's a couple communal tables that would comfortably seat six, a couple booths, and some two-seaters. A clean, and fun face-lift T. Cancun!!! 

I'm ALWAYS blown away at how scrumptious the food is. This past time I got a chicken taco, which was juicy and delicious. But previously I've gotten the shrimp burrito special, and a classic carne asada burrito. All of which made me forget about how frustrating it was to scramble cash bills. This is a Mission staple and I will one hundred percent be returning.

excerpts: I ordered a vegetarian wet "mojado" burrito to go around 11pm on a Friday night.
But otherwise the stuff inside the burrito was pretty yummy, not bad for a late night after drinking meal.
But I was quite sober when I ordered FYI.
burrito.author: Shruti D.
burrito.review:
I ordered a vegetarian wet "mojado" burrito to go around 11pm on a Friday night. 

It's topped with hella red enchilada sauce. I appreciate a lot of the sauce, but sadly, the enchilada sauce just tasted like the cheap stuff from the can just dumped on top, I could even kinda taste the metallic flavor from the can. :( 

But otherwise the stuff inside the burrito was pretty yummy, not bad for a late night after drinking meal. But I was quite sober when I ordered FYI. :D

It's so fat and massive, check the pics.

excerpts: Word on the street is the super burrito is the thing to try in SF and Mission is where to be.
We found this place on a list of places to eat.
It was a Monday night.
We easily ordered and received our food.
It's pretty authentic here, not offering ground beef tacos.
I had a super chicken burrito.
My Cousin had the carnitas and my daughter had a cheese quesadilla.
Not going to lie...
Anna's Taqueria in Boston has this place beat for flavor
but this burrito is a little bigger.
It needed more flavor but kudos on the real deal cheese here.
My daughters quesadilla had so much cheese
if she had eaten it she would have been backed up for days!
A little much.
It was ok but did not knock my socks off.
Also... the tortilla's didn't taste like they were made on site or fresh.
(Plus a $9 burrito?)
burrito.author: Holly W.
burrito.review: Word on the street is the super burrito is the thing to try in SF and Mission is where to be.  We found this place on a list of places to eat.  It was a Monday night.  We easily ordered and received our food.  It's pretty authentic here, not offering ground beef tacos.  I had a super chicken burrito. My Cousin had the carnitas and my daughter had a cheese quesadilla.  Not going to lie... Anna's Taqueria in Boston has this place beat for flavor but this burrito is a little bigger.  It needed more flavor but kudos on the real deal cheese here.  My daughters quesadilla had so much cheese if she had eaten it she would have been backed up for days!  A little much.  It was ok but did not knock my socks off.  Also... the tortilla's didn't taste like they were made on site or fresh.  (Plus a $9 burrito?)

excerpts: Disclaimer: I am rating this place almost entirely on their veggie burrito, salsas and service.
Vegetarian Burrito (minus cheese and sour cream)
Ok I know this may sound basic since this was essentially just beans, rice, pico de gallo and avocado wrapped in a tortilla
but thaT'S
WHY IT WAS
SO GOOD.
(Another disclaimer: I was also low-key buzzed and starving at the time of this meal), but regardless!
Everything inside was perfectly executed and the salsas provided alongside the basket of chips were clearly homemade, beautifully balanced, spicy and a great addition to the burrito.
I don't think y'all fully understand the value and difficulty level of making homemade salsa that white and Latinx people alike will enjoy.
burrito.author: Alex K.
burrito.review:
Disclaimer: I am rating this place almost entirely on their veggie burrito, salsas and service. 

My girlfriend and I came here after El Rio during Pride but before our next party stop, knowing we should probably fuel up a bit. There was a bit of a line, but it went by relatively quickly. The cashier was a young guy who seemed indifferent about the line but moved fast enough for me. We had:

-- Vegetarian Burrito (minus cheese and sour cream) // Ok I know this may sound basic since this was essentially just beans, rice, pico de gallo and avocado wrapped in a tortilla but thaT'S WHY IT WAS SO GOOD. (Another disclaimer: I was also low-key buzzed and starving at the time of this meal), but regardless! Everything inside was perfectly executed and the salsas provided alongside the basket of chips were clearly homemade, beautifully balanced, spicy and a great addition to the burrito. I don't think y'all fully understand the value and difficulty level of making homemade salsa that white and Latinx people alike will enjoy. But I digress. 

Servers were busy since there were quite a few people hungry for burritos and tacos. Still, they handled it all gracefully and refilled our salsas with no complaints when we asked, regardless of having multiple orders in hand at the time. 

I might just make this my new go-to late night spot regardless of it being a bit out of the way on my way home - the atmosphere is just what you would expect from a taqueria and in that sense, it feels like home to me.

excerpts:
I've been coming here for 10 years and there is nothing better than an al pastor (marinated pork) super burrito. 

This allows the burrito to not get soggy if you wrap it up to finish later.
burrito.author: Drew F.
burrito.review:
I've been coming here for 10 years and there is nothing better than an al pastor (marinated pork) super burrito. 

The meat is super good and the game changer is they toast the tortilla. This allows the burrito to not get soggy if you wrap it up to finish later. 

Open till late, too!

excerpts: My friend had the super burrito with chorizo which she said is also delicious!
They also do a vegetarian burrito if that's your thing!
burrito.author: Jess N.
burrito.review:
10/10 would recommend! The super nachos with carnitas were filling and cheap! I even took the extra home. Would come back again. It was great to have some great Mexican in San Francisco! 

My friend had the super burrito with chorizo which she said is also delicious! They also do a vegetarian burrito if that's your thing!

excerpts: I dunno, I think if you advertise yourself out front as "BEST VEGGIE BURRITO IN SAN FRANCISCO," you gotta show up with something besides onions, beans, avocado, rice, cheese, and a mild salsa.
It was totally adequate, I'd go there again in a heartbeat if I were a little tipsy, but it's nothing special.
The folks who work there are very nice and it makes for a good experience.
Salsa verde is superior, but it's nothing incredible.
burrito.author: Jacob H.
burrito.review: I dunno, I think if you advertise yourself out front as "BEST VEGGIE BURRITO IN SAN FRANCISCO," you gotta show up with something besides onions, beans, avocado, rice, cheese, and a mild salsa. It was totally adequate, I'd go there again in a heartbeat if I were a little tipsy, but it's nothing special. The folks who work there are very nice and it makes for a good experience. Salsa verde is superior, but it's nothing incredible.

excerpts: so I'm a big of a burrito snob.
burrito.author: Honeya O.
burrito.review:
It's ok, not bad... not great... good size, good price, quick service, average taste

ps... I grew up in the south-bay where we take our burritos seriously so I'm a big of a burrito snob.

excerpts: The burrito was on par
but I would say it was exceptional compared to its competitors.
They were very prompt in cleaning up when customers left and the staff behind the counter appeared professional and hardworking.
This is a great lunch stop but the burritos were about 4-stars
burrito.author: Nicholas L.
burrito.review: As far as Mexican food goes, this place is above average. They have a clean restaurant, friendly staff, and surprisingly great salsa. The burrito was on par but I would say it was exceptional compared to its competitors. They were very prompt in cleaning up when customers left and the staff behind the counter appeared professional and hardworking. This is a great lunch stop but the burritos were about 4-stars

excerpts: Vegetarians: go here for a veggie burrito.
Vegans: they'll add more Avocado at no extra charge to substitute the subtraction of cheese and sour cream.

They're nice dudes who run the spot who never serve anything but fresh ingredients and best of all, this location is open until 3am on Friday and Saturdays and rarely will you see d-bags of the sort that frequent the original location on 18th and mission.
burrito.author: Kristina B.
burrito.review:
Vegetarians: go here for a veggie burrito. Vegans: they'll add more Avocado at no extra charge to substitute the subtraction of cheese and sour cream. 
They're nice dudes who run the spot who never serve anything but fresh ingredients and best of all, this location is open until 3am on Friday and Saturdays and rarely will you see d-bags of the sort that frequent the original location on 18th and mission.

excerpts: Reluctantly stopped in again this week for a burrito and quesadilla.
Extra greasy; tough, rubbery chicken; not a fan of the chips either--too hard and grainy.
I want to like this place, especially because it's open late, but the food is just terrible.
So much better food available elsewhere.
burrito.author: J. C.
burrito.review: This place is horrible. I can't understand how they stand in business. Reluctantly stopped in again this week for a burrito and quesadilla. Extra greasy; tough, rubbery chicken; not a fan of the chips either--too hard and grainy. I want to like this place, especially because it's open late, but the food is just terrible. So much better food available elsewhere.

excerpts: It could just be that at the other location, they make the outside burrito shell a little bit crispier on the grill, I'm not sure.
But you still won't go wrong with either place.
burrito.author: John J.
burrito.review:
You will be happy here. Excellent veggie, prawn, and steak burritos.

I prefer the other location on Mission & 19th St, which has best burritos in town. But that location is closed for remodeling so this is the second best place in town. I don't know why it tastes slightly different here but it does. It could just be that at the other location, they make the outside burrito shell a little bit crispier on the grill, I'm not sure. 
But you still won't go wrong with either place.

excerpts: She ordered a burrito and I had two different tacos.
Tortillas and meat were very fresh.
Not too heavy and the flavors were classic.
burrito.author: Amy R.
burrito.review:
Come with your Spanish polished:) You'll get a small order of chips and salsa if you eat in. They have water to serve yourself which seems to be the neighborhood trend. Remember cash only, but ATM on site. 

She ordered a burrito and I had two different tacos. Tortillas and meat were very fresh. Not too heavy and the flavors were classic. Great option for plain old good Mexican food. 

Staff was also very friendly!

excerpts: Carne Asada super burrito is THE order here.
Like Angels tap dancing on my tongue.
burrito.author: Greg C.
burrito.review: Used to eat here in the 1990s.  Dreamed of it every since and each time I come back from the east coast, Taqueria Cancun is a must. It never disappointments.  Carne Asada super burrito is THE order here.  Like Angels tap dancing on my tongue.

excerpts: Typical wet burrito, nothing to fancy or special ot set itself apart from anything else
BUT it wasn't a bad burrito, just a very basic one.
There are defineitly other burrito spots in the city where you can get a much better burrito for your money.
burrito.author: Navdeep D.
burrito.review: Superrrrr basic Mexican food. Went there to try out the hype and it definitely did not live up to the hype. Typical wet burrito, nothing to fancy or special ot set itself apart from anything else BUT it wasn't a bad burrito, just a very basic one. There are defineitly other burrito spots in the city where you can get a much better burrito for your money.

excerpts: It's my go-to every time I crave a good burrito!
burrito.author: Mandy F.
burrito.review:
This is hands down, my favorite taqueria in the mission....I live around the corner from El Farolito + La Taqueria...so that says a lot. 

-fast service
-the guys are always super nice and give you extra salsa if you ask
-best horchata
-their nachos (veggie or with meat I've had both) are fire
-super burritos (veggie or with meat I've had both) are bomb and filling
-tacos are amazing

Pretty much just great all around. 
It's my go-to every time I crave a good burrito!

excerpts: Got the large wet burrito and a beer when I was there on a busy Fri night.
burrito.author: Marcus K.
burrito.review:
The place is a-OK.   Kinda hole in the wallish but come on in.  Order at the counter and then have a seat til the call you up.   Seats about 20-30 but of course you can get take out.  You may even want take out and head to the bar across the street.  

They have burritos, tacos and a variety of plates.  It's not a huge selection but that's ok.   Got the large wet burrito and a beer when I was there on a busy Fri night.   It was ready in no time.  

Flavor is good.  Lots of meat and rice.  Lots of sauce and cheese melted into the plate.  Was able to eat half and took the rest home in a go bag. 

I know a lot of people rave about this place and I have to say that it was good but no more than many other Mexican restaurants in the city.  Not sure that I would go out of my way to get here but if I was walking down the street I just might come in back.

excerpts: Every Mexican place I go to I always get the Carne Assad Super Burrito.
I'd have to say this is behind Taqueria San Bruno regarding the taste.
Behind La Taqueria regarding the balance of ingredients inside of the burrito.
Behind El Farolito regarding size and a slight lower grade in taste.
That being said, it's not too far off from these 3 spots.
Great taste, Great price, very stuffing.
There just wasn't a WOW factor.
Chips were okay
burrito.author: Jason F.
burrito.review: Every Mexican place I go to I always get the Carne Assad Super Burrito. I'd have to say this is behind Taqueria San Bruno regarding the taste. Behind La Taqueria regarding the balance of ingredients inside of the burrito. Behind El Farolito regarding size and a slight lower grade in taste. That being said, it's not too far off from these 3 spots. Great taste, Great price, very stuffing. There just wasn't a WOW factor. Chips were okay

excerpts: Hot damn this is a good burrito.
I had a super burrito with carne asada, and it was magnificent.
Great balance of flavors without being greasy or heavy.
The green salsa goes well with it too.
burrito.author: Price H.
burrito.review: Hot damn this is a good burrito. I had a super burrito with carne asada, and it was magnificent. Great balance of flavors without being greasy or heavy. The green salsa goes well with it too.

excerpts: Went for some tacos and a burrito and it was amazing.
It tasted like my mothers cooking and that's a major plus this place is honestly so good and really good on pricing.
New favorite spot.
burrito.author: Maria H.
burrito.review: Went for some tacos and a burrito and it was amazing. It tasted like my mothers cooking and that's a major plus this place is honestly so good and really good on pricing. New favorite spot.

excerpts: But with all these hipster-ish restaurants and all, sometimes you just want a nice taco/burrito to go, go back home and watch some utterly offensive Jim Jefferies stand up comedy, with a bottle of cold beer and some laughters.
burrito.author: Kevin L.
burrito.review:
The low key, underrated Mexican food joint. That's my thing. 

There's no lack of Mexican food on Valencia, I'm aware of that first night I stayed around. But with all these hipster-ish restaurants and all, sometimes you just want a nice taco/burrito to go, go back home and watch some utterly offensive Jim Jefferies stand up comedy, with a bottle of cold beer and some laughters. 

So yeah. Late night and nowhere to go? Cancun is your best friend. Don't mind staying at the restaurant if you don't feel like to. Yeah don't let the interior fools you, the food is killing it.

excerpts: Probably my favorite mission burrito place.
I like this location and the one actually in the mission.
Both are dives but the burrito is incredible and lasts for 2 meals.
The guy was super cool
and I added egg to my veggie burrito.
They give you chips too wherever you eat in or take out.
burrito.author: Alison B.
burrito.review:
Probably my favorite mission burrito place. I like this location and the one actually in the mission. Both are dives but the burrito is incredible and lasts for 2 meals. The guy was super cool and I added egg to my veggie burrito. They give you chips too wherever you eat in or take out. Washed it all down with horchata. 

Green salsa is killer! Some of the best so don't miss it!

excerpts: For $8.50 you get a huge burrito plus chips.
I liked that they heat the tortilla to the point that it's a little crispy like on a quesadilla.
I don't know what it is in the burrito that makes it so special, but you'll look forward to every bite no matter how full  you get.
The interior is great as well, with bright yellow walls and dozens of little flags hanging from the ceiling.
burrito.author: Ben E.
burrito.review: One of the best vegetarian burritos I've had. For $8.50 you get a huge burrito plus chips. I liked that they heat the tortilla to the point that it's a little crispy like on a quesadilla. I don't know what it is in the burrito that makes it so special, but you'll look forward to every bite no matter how full  you get. The interior is great as well, with bright yellow walls and dozens of little flags hanging from the ceiling.

excerpts: $5 for a burrito so big
I had to finish it in two meals, plus chips and salsa.
Pretty good deal
Ironically, the chips was actually much, much tastier than the burrito itself.
The burrito had a lot of stuffing (meat, rice, beans etc), but ended up being very dry with not a lot of sauce.
The chips, on the other hand, was surprisingly good--it wasn't just plain tortilla chips, they had some kind of spice baked into it.
burrito.author: Henry L.
burrito.review:
Can anyone say "crazy cheap burritos"? Damn!

$5 for a burrito so big I had to finish it in two meals, plus chips and salsa. Pretty good deal if I do say so me'self

Ironically, the chips was actually much, much tastier than the burrito itself.

The burrito had a lot of stuffing (meat, rice, beans etc), but ended up being very dry with not a lot of sauce. The chips, on the other hand, was surprisingly good--it wasn't just plain tortilla chips, they had some kind of spice baked into it. The salsa sauce served on the side was also had a real spicy KiCK to it.

The inside was decorated like some kind of festival is going on All Da Time, which is uplifting in a way.

Weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee

excerpts: My husband liked their burrito too.
Funny thing is since trying this place, we've gone here a few times.
Went here before getting discharged from the hospital and many times we've gone to doctor's appointments.
We do love mexican food.
I think my one qualm is I wish it had more sour cream.
I think the great review is the great memories that's tied to it.
burrito.author: Claire J.
burrito.review:
When I was pregnant, I told my husband the first meal I want to have after my labor is a good steak quesadilla from a taqueria.  My husband delivered.  He picked this place because it's walking distance from St. Luke's hospital.  It did take a while for me to enjoy my first meal but it was good.  It wasn't the best quesadilla, I still like El Farolito's or La Guadajalara but this one was good enough.  My husband liked their burrito too.  Funny thing is since trying this place, we've gone here a few times.  Went here before getting discharged from the hospital and many times we've gone to doctor's appointments.  We do love mexican food.  I think my one qualm is I wish it had more sour cream.  
 I think the great review is the great memories that's tied to it.

excerpts: Great late-night burrito.
The al pastor burrito was passed around and (almost) unanimously voted "best burrito we've ever eaten.
burrito.author: James W.
burrito.review:
Great late-night burrito. 

It's what you'd expect: kind of dirty, hard cafeteria seats and packed to the gills. Lots of savory meats on the grill. Tacos, burritos with every part of a cow or pig (or chicken) that you'd want. They are generous with the meat. 

Only disappointing part was lack of a salsa bar, only giving you a small side of pico de gallo. 

The al pastor burrito was passed around and (almost) unanimously voted "best burrito we've ever eaten." Our DD (and only sober taste tester) the next morning clarified, "it was just alright."

So, if you come in the cold light of day, it may be a different experience.

excerpts: I got my "super" burrito with no sour cream expecting me to eat all dry.
So I returned it and when I was telling him he looked at the burrito all
confused
so I opened it up and showed him.
Who ever is the manager should really teach them customer service and how to make there own food they have on the menu.
burrito.author: Lola B.
burrito.review: If I could give negative stars I would. I came here for the first time and the cashier was really rude! I got my "super" burrito with no sour cream expecting me to eat all dry. So I returned it and when I was telling him he looked at the burrito all confused so I opened it up and showed him. Who ever is the manager should really teach them customer service and how to make there own food they have on the menu.

excerpts: Best spot to get a burrito after some drinks.
The carne asada super burrito is extremely good, top it off with the green sauce and you are good to go.
It's a cash only place, they have an ATM there
but it's a $3 fee.
It's my favorite spot to get a burrito at all hours of the day.
burrito.author: Steven C.
burrito.review: Best spot to get a burrito after some drinks. The carne asada super burrito is extremely good, top it off with the green sauce and you are good to go. It's a cash only place, they have an ATM there but it's a $3 fee. It's my favorite spot to get a burrito at all hours of the day.

excerpts: Got the burrito mojado de carne asada and it was just OK.
The meat wasn't anything special.
I thought the sour cream or crema on top was too sour.
The burrito is a decent size.
burrito.author: Heejin L.
burrito.review:
The food here is just average and pricey for what you get, I thought. 
Got the burrito mojado de carne asada and it was just OK.  The meat wasn't anything special.   I thought the sour cream or crema on top was too sour.  The burrito is a decent size.

The shrimp cocktail tasted off.  The shrimp tasted gritty. 
Horchata was average and slightly watery for my taste.

excerpts: you can't find a place that is cheaper than this 6.50 for super burrito 5.50 for regular and a vegetarian!!
only thing they speak little English! so little hard to order something that little more then they can understand.
oh well I'll still come bk!
bc
it's cheap!!!
lol!!!
burrito.author: Lizzie G.
burrito.review:
you can't find a place that is cheaper than this 6.50 for super burrito 5.50 for regular and a vegetarian!! 
only thing they speak little English! so little hard to order something that little more then they can understand. 
oh well I'll still come bk! bc it's cheap!!! lol!!!

excerpts: burrito, it was eh, you'd think for $8 they would give u more than a baby slice of avocado.
burrito.author: Rocky R.
burrito.review:
The plus?? it didn't give me food poisoning.

Now for the minus. Ordered a bean and rice burrito, it was eh, you'd think for $8 they would give u more than a baby slice of avocado. 

There's no salsa bar, and when you ask for more salsa, they'll tell you "there's some in the bag (yes a teaspoon)" and when you ask for more, you get a crazy attitude look and one more salsa. 

Too much mexican food in the mission to put up with that.

excerpts: Just got a burrito for lunch, didn't finish it (and I finished almost everything I get)
Guy handed it to me in gloves with raw beef blood on it.
burrito.author: John L.
burrito.review:
Inedible, I end up going once a year since it's literally right next door to my apartment.
I have no clue where these 5 star reviews come from. Take your money someplace else, you'll even have a better meal from safeway up the block!

Just got a burrito for lunch, didn't finish it (and I finished almost everything I get)
Guy handed it to me in gloves with raw beef blood on it. Inside was nasty tasting as well

The restaurant smells of some industrial cleaning product (though it's not very clean) - so much cleaner that your nose will start to hurt. I wonder if they are covering up for some sort of other nasty smell.

I will not be coming back.

excerpts: I heavily rely on lengthy Mission Street as my 5-star destination for my burrito craving.
You can't go wrong with most of the finer taquerias for your craving of the "silver bullet.
I came here for lunch and ordered my usual super burrito.
For $6.00, I get the grilled steak with rice, beans, salsa, avocado, sour cream, Mexican cheese, chopped onions and cilantro in a large flour tortilla.
All the key interior ingredients were fresh and tasty and the grilled meat was grilled very nicely.
But the cook burnt my tortilla while cooking it on the grill.
Burning the tortilla is a minor issue, but I'll continue to come back and eat my burrito here and other food.
burrito.author: Matt G.
burrito.review:
I heavily rely on lengthy Mission Street as my 5-star destination for my burrito craving. You can't go wrong with most of the finer taquerias for your craving of the "silver bullet."

But after my recent visit to Taqueria Cancun near Bernal Heights, I may have depended on them way too much. 

I came here for lunch and ordered my usual super burrito. For $6.00, I get the grilled steak with rice, beans, salsa, avocado, sour cream, Mexican cheese, chopped onions and cilantro in a large flour tortilla. All the key interior ingredients were fresh and tasty and the grilled meat was grilled very nicely. But the cook burnt my tortilla while cooking it on the grill. I don't mind the tortilla being a little burnt, but it was overly scorched (see my picture and would you eat that?).

I've been eating here about forty times, but never had any problems here until today. Burning the tortilla is a minor issue, but I'll continue to come back and eat my burrito here and other food.

excerpts: Carne Asada Burrito =
Stomach Ache
The very least I expect from a $10 burrito is for it not to jack up my intestines.
burrito.author: Jim M.
burrito.review:
Carne Asada Burrito = Stomach Ache all next day and bathroom visits in the high single digits.

The very least I expect from a $10 burrito is for it not to jack up my intestines.

excerpts: This morning I just ordered a chorizo and eggs breakfast burrito and ended up with a greasy soggy
burrito
that only has beans chorizo meat and cheese.
The most disgusting burrito
I've seen in my life.
burrito.author: Ron P.
burrito.review: This place has messed up my order several times now. Worst part is that the order is very simple yet these guys always mess it up. This morning I just ordered a chorizo and eggs breakfast burrito and ended up with a greasy soggy burrito that only has beans chorizo meat and cheese. The most disgusting burrito I've seen in my life.

excerpts: I'm at St. Luke's Hospital in early labor and all I want right now through these contractions is a super veggie burrito from Can Cun.
burrito.author: Bonnie G.
burrito.review:
I'm at St. Luke's Hospital in early labor and all I want right now through these contractions is a super veggie burrito from Can Cun. 

That's what I think of this place.

excerpts: Hey, if you've got a big appetite or you know your date does, then you might like how the burrito is stuffed, rolled and covered in sauce here.
The competition for best virgin burrito in SF is a tight one.
This joint is just about as good as any other.
If your date eats the whole enchilada (meaning burrito), your luck will probably run out shortly.
Those things are big enough to stuff a mule and keep it going until it gets to the other side of the border.
burrito.author: Anna L.
burrito.review: Hey, if you've got a big appetite or you know your date does, then you might like how the burrito is stuffed, rolled and covered in sauce here. The competition for best virgin burrito in SF is a tight one. This joint is just about as good as any other. If your date eats the whole enchilada (meaning burrito), your luck will probably run out shortly. Those things are big enough to stuff a mule and keep it going until it gets to the other side of the border.

excerpts: I got the super burrito with carne asada and it tasted great!
The chips and salsa are pretty good too.
burrito.author: Jason X.
burrito.review:
I got the super burrito with carne asada and it tasted great! The chips and salsa are pretty good too. The order comes out pretty quickly so if the line seems long, don't worry, it'll move fast. 

Not a great dine-in spot, definitely more of a late night place. It's a pretty small restaurant, a little dirty, and the place probably seats about 30 people.

excerpts: This is my favorite Mission burrito spot.
Way less of a line than some nearby spots
and I prefer their burrito over other more highly touted places in the area.
burrito.author: max m.
burrito.review:
This is my favorite Mission burrito spot. Way less of a line than some nearby spots and I prefer their burrito over other more highly touted places in the area. 

Seating can be a bit hard to come by.

excerpts: The owner decided to get greedy and increase the price for a super and veggie burrito to $9 ($10 after tax).
Insane.
Absolutely boycotting.
burrito.author: David C.
burrito.review: They just raised their prices to a ridiculous amount and I will now boycott them indefinitely. Plenty of other places to go in the mission. The owner decided to get greedy and increase the price for a super and veggie burrito to $9 ($10 after tax). Insane. Absolutely boycotting.

excerpts: Delicious burrito overflowing with the ingredients.
The tortilla grilled, toasted then I just love that.
Not too much cheese, everything tastes so fresh.
Complimentary chips and salsa, pico de Gallo and green salsa.
I love this place.
burrito.author: Tasina H.
burrito.review: Quick service. Delicious burrito overflowing with the ingredients. The tortilla grilled, toasted then I just love that. Not too much cheese, everything tastes so fresh. Complimentary chips and salsa, pico de Gallo and green salsa. I love this place.

excerpts: I've been to most of them that haven't been established in the near term (3 or 4 years) but I grew up on taqueria cancun (since the 80's @ the orig in 6th & Market) and I love me some BURRITO MOJADO or ALAMBRE.
No one makes a wet burrito like taqueria cancun.
Get al pastor or legua for meat choices.
Stay away from your boring dry burrito guys.
Make it WET...the pleasure is all there.
Don't knock it till you try it.
C'mon live a little...
burrito.author: Jules S.
burrito.review:
Wow!  When you go away from this stuff for a long time it taste crazy good.  I know a lot of people prefer other taquerias in the city...I've been to most of them that haven't been established in the near term (3 or 4 years) but I grew up on taqueria cancun (since the 80's @ the orig in 6th & Market) and I love me some BURRITO MOJADO or ALAMBRE.  No one makes a wet burrito like taqueria cancun.  Get al pastor or legua for meat choices.  If you like something different go for the cabesa or sesos.

Stay away from your boring dry burrito guys.  Make it WET...the pleasure is all there.  Don't knock it till you try it.  C'mon live a little...be adventurous.

Really great service over here this afternoon.  If you speak Spanish, even a little, it goes a long way.

excerpts: Got the veggie burrito ...'twas so delicious!!
burrito.author: T R.
burrito.review:
Solid spot for Mexican food in the city.

Got the veggie burrito ...'twas so delicious!! My boyfriend got two carne asada super tacos that were easily...hands down the best tacos I've ever tried and seen so far in my life as a Californian.

Definitely will choose this location over the one on market and 6th. It's cleaner, bigger and the tacos are better.

They kindly give you chips with quac AND salsa! Incredible

excerpts: But, the great SF burrito debate drags on.
This place is best for broke people with no textural sense, but looking for nutritional sustenance.
First; why lettuce on a burrito?
It just wilts and turns to mush.
Second; why rice on a burrito?
But this is a fundamental requirement for many burrito fans; so we just have to agree to disagree.
For me, rice is just extra carb filler.
It adds nothing to burritos other than size.
Salsa here is lame.
burrito.author: Josh K.
burrito.review:
To this day I cannot fathom how this place has a following.  But, the great SF burrito debate drags on.
This place is best for broke people with no textural sense, but looking for nutritional sustenance.
First; why lettuce on a burrito?  It just wilts and turns to mush.
Second; why rice on a burrito?  But this is a fundamental requirement for many burrito fans; so we just have to agree to disagree.   For me, rice is just extra carb filler.  It adds nothing to burritos other than size.
Salsa here is lame.

excerpts: I'm always on the lookout for a place that has a great $5 burrito, and yes, they have it here.
burrito.author: Matthew D.
burrito.review:
Make that 200 reviews for Taqueria Cancun.

Okay, I'll say it again:  Lots of places serve "good Mexican food".  Here, you can certainly get it.  I'm always on the lookout for a place that has a great $5 burrito, and yes, they have it here.

This is one of those "if you're in the neighborhood" places.  Yes, if you are, this is a place you will want to visit for solidly good Mexifood at a good price.

excerpts: I saw the guy who was preparing by burrito spit in my food.
The burrito was soggy after.
I think it because I'm white.
I think this is another one of those racist Mexican restaurants in SF.
I hadn't done anything wrong.
If these people don't like their jobs, then I think they should quit.
I am proud of who I am and I will not be ashamed because I'm white.
burrito.author: Rich A.
burrito.review: I saw the guy who was preparing by burrito spit in my food. The burrito was soggy after. I think it because I'm white. I think this is another one of those racist Mexican restaurants in SF. I hadn't done anything wrong. If these people don't like their jobs, then I think they should quit. I am proud of who I am and I will not be ashamed because I'm white.

excerpts: By far and away the best burrito I've had in the Mission.
That is all.
burrito.author: Tarah D.
burrito.review: By far and away the best burrito I've had in the Mission.  That is all.

excerpts: FYI - The vegetarian burrito is not as the rice isn't vegetarian or vegan (cooked with chicken stock).
burrito.author: Kris R.
burrito.review: FYI - The vegetarian burrito is not as the rice isn't vegetarian or vegan (cooked with chicken stock).

excerpts: Try it late at night, when convenience and sloppy quantity is more important than the cheapest, best burrito, and you'll be more than satisfied.
burrito.author: Cailin H.
burrito.review: Most recently of Nate Silver fame, Taqueria Cancun definitely has a reputation, which may be more hype than anything else. It's definitely not bad, but I've had the famous al pastor a couple of times, and the most memorable part was how wet and messy it was. Try it late at night, when convenience and sloppy quantity is more important than the cheapest, best burrito, and you'll be more than satisfied.

excerpts: 2nd stop on my burrito tour of SF!
Super burrito, duh.
They do a good job of toasting the tortilla so it's all quesadilla-like.
burrito.author: Lian T.
burrito.review:
2nd stop on my burrito tour of SF!

A++. Complimentary chips & I am SOLD!
Jk, I'm not so easy, BUT the burritos here are definitely winning. The staff is unbelievably friendly and nice and the crowd is an assortment of young trendy groups and straight up hungry people.

Super burrito, duh. They do a good job of toasting the tortilla so it's all quesadilla-like.

excerpts: I suddenly felt an urge for a Burrito , Ed Lover was deep in Conversation with the Ladies .
So me being the Polite and Discreet guy that I am ,not wanting to disrupt his flow. .
Popped outside to the front of the bar and left a Voice mail letting him know where i was at .
I wandered in to Taqueria Cancun LOL.
Its a hole in the wall
but it was packed with Mission Street Hipsters and a few Thug life type folks.
So I got in line and Ordered an Al Pastor Super Burrito and was given Chips Salsa and Guacamole as an appetizer .
My Burrito was ready in 5 minutes and it was a BIG.
I started in and it was the Yummiest Burrito
Ive had in a while.
I was half way through my Burrito and received a call from my Bodyguard Ed worried about me wandering around in such a rough neighborhood alone LOL.
I let him know where I was and he entered TC like the Pinoy Tupac that he is and let his presence be known WEST SIDE!!!
I will have to return again and try more items out.
burrito.author: Eugene L.
burrito.review:
My Bodyguard Ed Lover Muay Thai Street Fighter and I were out Bar hopping in the Mission the Other Night and I Spotted Taqueria Can -Cun which peaked my interest but we were a little thirsty . So we popped into a Bar for a drink . Ed and I were engaged in great conversation with a couple of lovely ladies. I suddenly felt an urge for a Burrito , Ed Lover was deep in Conversation with the Ladies . So me being the Polite and Discreet guy that I am ,not wanting to disrupt his flow. . Popped outside to the front of the bar and left a Voice mail letting him know where i was at . I wandered in to Taqueria Cancun LOL. Its a hole in the wall but it was packed with Mission Street Hipsters and a few Thug life type folks. So I got in line and Ordered an Al Pastor Super Burrito and was given Chips Salsa and Guacamole as an appetizer . My Burrito was ready in 5 minutes and it was a BIG. 
I started in and it was the Yummiest Burrito Ive had in a while. I was half way through my Burrito and received a call from my Bodyguard Ed worried about me wandering around in such a rough neighborhood alone LOL. I let him know where I was and he entered TC like the Pinoy Tupac that he is and let his presence be known WEST SIDE!!! 
I will have to return again and try more items out.

excerpts: Ordered a burrito here about a few weeks ago.
It was disappointing.
I took it home and regret every bite.
I ordered a lengua burrito
but it turned out to be more like a veg-burrito, with a few small pieces of meat.
burrito.author: M R.
burrito.review:
Ordered a burrito here about a few weeks ago. It was disappointing. I took it home and regret every bite. I ordered a lengua burrito but it turned out to be more like a veg-burrito, with a few small pieces of meat. 85% of it was beans and rice. 

Skip it there are better places down the way. Oh, this is a review only for this location. I like and have no complaints of their other two locations (SOMA and the one near 17th and Mission).

excerpts: had a super veggie burrito
and it was good.
has a fun, festive atmosphere.
feels like a beach spot.
burrito.author: Denise C.
burrito.review: good Mexican restaurant. had a super veggie burrito and it was good. has a fun, festive atmosphere. feels like a beach spot.

excerpts: This is the pick of many local for the best burrito in the Mission and for god reason.
The service is fast and friendly with a spacious and clean dining area.
They wrap the burritos full here
and you'll easily have enough for two meals.
burrito.author: Darren F.
burrito.review: This is the pick of many local for the best burrito in the Mission and for god reason. The service is fast and friendly with a spacious and clean dining area. They wrap the burritos full here and you'll easily have enough for two meals.

excerpts: Carnitas burrito and a horchata the size of my face.
burrito.author: Shana H.
burrito.review:
Carnitas burrito and a horchata the size of my face. My deathbed request for a final meal. 

I moved to CT and I miss Cancun every day.

excerpts: Looking for a no-frills, Classic Burrito experience in the Mission?

Well this is the place...selection of fillings include grilled and shredded versions of chicken and steak; tasty marinated carnitas; chips and a flavorful salsa verde round out the meal - and they offer Mexican coke to wash everything down with.
burrito.author: Rich R.
burrito.review: Looking for a no-frills, Classic Burrito experience in the Mission?  Well this is the place...selection of fillings include grilled and shredded versions of chicken and steak; tasty marinated carnitas; chips and a flavorful salsa verde round out the meal - and they offer Mexican coke to wash everything down with.

excerpts: For the really hungry try their Burrito Mojado (A Big One) meat, rice, beans, onions, cilantro, salsa, topped with enchilada sauce, green salsa, melted cheese, sour cream & mexican salsa -colorfully festive in decoration
it's still a bit divey, Not a place you'd want to linger too long, but good for a tasty, cheap and filling meal.
burrito.author: Aaron Z.
burrito.review: One of a few very good choices of taquerias within a 10 block stretch of Mission. This is the one out near Valencia( Burger King across the street)  at the foot of Bernal- They have a few simple items and do things  their way , which just happens to be quite a good way  they actually cook the sandwiches and burritos on a flat  griddle top, that's what give them a nice crispy exterior. Pastor ( pork) and carne asada burritos are real winners in the meat category and the veggie super ( $ 8.75) is hard to put down in one sitting. The place does a steady business at lunches and evenings. Good beer selection, aguas frescas, veggie juices & homemade tortilla chips, note : they are a little skimpy with the salsa, do not have kid portions and it's cash on the barrelhead only, son. For the really hungry try their Burrito Mojado (A Big One) meat, rice, beans, onions, cilantro, salsa, topped with enchilada sauce, green salsa, melted cheese, sour cream & mexican salsa -colorfully festive in decoration it's still a bit divey, Not a place you'd want to linger too long, but good for a tasty, cheap and filling meal.

excerpts: (delish) to the Porcetta Sandwich @Roli Roti (a big WOW for taste), & now a super burrito @Taqueria Cancun.
Although a cheap-o burrito, you'd think taste would be comprised.
Nope, not the case here.
We ordered a super steak burrito, no rice, and black beans.
The tortilla was slightly grilled & had a nice, little crunch to it even.
The burrito had savory chunks of plentiful carne asada w/ just the right amount of cheese.
I loved the fresh slices of avocado, too.
Half a burrrito later....
I was satisfied.
burrito.author: Joy A.
burrito.review:
Holy Mother of Burritos! Taqueria Cancun, you are gooooooood!!!!

SF's 7x7 list has been on a roll lately. From the bacon wrapped oysters @Anchor & Hope (delish) to the Porcetta Sandwich @Roli Roti (a big WOW for taste), & now a super burrito @Taqueria Cancun. Thank you, 7x7, for introducing me to this spot. 

What's even more amazing is that it ONLY cost $5.99. Awesome deal!!!

Although a cheap-o burrito, you'd think taste would be comprised. Nope, not the case here. We ordered a super steak burrito, no rice, and black beans. The tortilla was slightly grilled & had a nice, little crunch to it even. The burrito had savory chunks of plentiful carne asada w/ just the right amount of cheese. I loved the fresh slices of avocado, too. Half a burrrito later....I was satisfied. And now, I have lunch for tomorrow.

Overall: Thankful to have found this cool taqueria. Service was good (friendly cashier) & it's a clean, no frills, casual spot to grab a quick bite to eat! Big thumbs up to their super burritos!

Tips:
*Bring quarters for the parking meters.
*Bring cash. Credit cards are not accepted.
*Chips & (spicy) salsa are complimentary. Woohoo!

excerpts: My favorite burrito place in SF.
Flaky tortillas, fresh grilled meats, great avocado, nice service.
burrito.author: Nelson M.
burrito.review:
My favorite burrito place in SF. Flaky tortillas, fresh grilled meats, great avocado, nice service. And never crowded, at least at lunch, mellow and convenient.

Two years later, still my favorite place.

excerpts: but my go-to order is always a burrito.
A vegetarian burrito runs about $6 here and gets you a HUGE burrito filled with rice, pinto beans, cheese, tomato, onion, cilantro and avocado.
With so many other taquerias in the Mission, Taqueria Cancun isn't my go-to place for a burrito
burrito.author: Stephanie C.
burrito.review:
While it's not my favorite taqueria in the city, Taqueria Cancun doesn't fall short in making good burritos. That's just it though...they're good, not great. 

I've had a couple other dishes, like tacos and super quesadillas but my go-to order is always a burrito. A vegetarian burrito runs about $6 here and gets you a HUGE burrito filled with rice, pinto beans, cheese, tomato, onion, cilantro and avocado. I can never finish the whole thing in one sitting, so their burritos are perfect for leftovers since they're so big! 

Also, their chips aren't my favorite and I feel like they're kinda stale. They give you two different kinds of salsa - pico de gallo and salsa verde. Salsa verde is pretty spicy but definitely my favorite out of the two.

With so many other taquerias in the Mission, Taqueria Cancun isn't my go-to place for a burrito but it's still a good choice if you're in Bernal Heights.

*Cash ONLY!*

excerpts: This is a bit awkward to reveal, but the thing is, I'm a burrito skeptic.
(I know, I know, like being an agnostic in the Bible Belt.)
It's just...
why do I need soooo much relatively flavorless rice and tortilla and cheese and sour cream?
Then I moved a few blocks away from Taqueria Cancun, and finally understood the purpose of the burrito.
What made the difference?
burrito.author: Amy L.
burrito.review:
This is a bit awkward to reveal, but the thing is, I'm a burrito skeptic. (I know, I know, like being an agnostic in the Bible Belt.) It's just...why do I need soooo much relatively flavorless rice and tortilla and cheese and sour cream? Why not skip the fillers, stick to the good parts, and just order tacos?

Then I moved a few blocks away from Taqueria Cancun, and finally understood the purpose of the burrito. What made the difference? Largely the big chunks of fresh avocado where most places use guacamole, but the fresh-griddled tortilla and restrained hand with the sour cream and cheese don't hurt either. 

I personally think the beef and the chorizo are the best meat choices, but the al pastor was the only option I've tried that genuinely disappointed.

excerpts: Ordered my al pastor in super burrito style.
I was hungry, yo.
Burrito was great.
Tortilla was nicely grilled adding that slight crunch to the bite!
Meat was juicy, warm, tender, flavorful.
Towards finishing it up, I noticed no sign of runny grease at the bottom of my foil.
Didn't make the burrito dry though.
As much as I try to find a burrito that comes close to what I've had in SoCal, or Mexican food much less, this place falls a little short.
Don't get me wrong though.
Awesome food.
I'm just real picky about this kind.
But try it out and see for yourself.
burrito.author: Will S.
burrito.review:
Al Pastor was its name. And eating was the game. 

Ordered my al pastor in super burrito style. I was hungry, yo. Burrito was great. Tortilla was nicely grilled adding that slight crunch to the bite! Meat was juicy, warm, tender, flavorful. Towards finishing it up, I noticed no sign of runny grease at the bottom of my foil. Didn't make the burrito dry though. Just felt that something was missing.

3.5 stars. As much as I try to find a burrito that comes close to what I've had in SoCal, or Mexican food much less, this place falls a little short. Don't get me wrong though. Awesome food. I'm just real picky about this kind. But try it out and see for yourself.

excerpts: This is the one place I opt for a veggie burrito over a taco.
Why?
Science.
The lightly toasted tortilla on the burrito equals amazing.
I don't love the chips or the salsa, but I can look past this because the burrito really is that good.
burrito.author: Amber K.
burrito.review:
This is the one place I opt for a veggie burrito over a taco. Why? Science. The lightly toasted tortilla on the burrito equals amazing. 

I don't love the chips or the salsa, but I can look past this because the burrito really is that good.

excerpts: Abundance of those pieces that no one wants to chew in their carne asada burrito no matter how drunk you are.
Every single time, in every burrito.
burrito.author: j m.
burrito.review:
After going here so many times and putting up with it I have decided to just say this:

Gristle. Abundance of those pieces that no one wants to chew in their carne asada burrito no matter how drunk you are. Every single time, in every burrito.

The "out of the bag chip thing" I can overlook if the food was better. But in this case I can't even do that.

excerpts: I'd rather close my eyes and skip the metaphorical advisory and devour their bomb burrito in Bear Grylls bliss.
burrito.author: Monica S.
burrito.review:
You know that moment when you're watching Man vs. Wild and the advisory pops up telling you about how all those amazing stunts Bear Grylls does are merely staged demonstrations and not actual survival tactics based on life-threatening situations? 

I close my eyes too during this advisory because I'd rather watch the show pretending everything's happening because the lion is actually chasing him or it's so cold that he physically needs to gut a camel, drag its entrails and sleep in within its boney carcass.  

The point I'm trying to arrive at is I don't care where the meat comes from in Taqueria Cancun's burritos. I'd rather close my eyes and skip the metaphorical advisory and devour their bomb burrito in Bear Grylls bliss.

excerpts: Chicken burrito debauchery will be remembered far longer than my spring break debauchery.
Not spending time in this Cancun drunk certainly helps.
burrito.author: Jason B.
burrito.review:
Cancun vs. Cancun.

One features tackiness and drunk college students. Yes I went. And yes I'm judging years later.

Other features delicious and massive burritos for a college drink special price ($5) as well as service faster than it takes a frat boy to drink his beer.

Chicken burrito debauchery will be remembered far longer than my spring break debauchery. Not spending time in this Cancun drunk certainly helps.

excerpts: I'd rather go somewhere else in the neighborhood, where I know I can end up with 1) the kind of burrito I ordered and 2) not a pocket full of odd change.
burrito.author: Joel S.
burrito.review:
I used to frequent this place when I lived in SoMa (Sleazy 6th, to be exact). The service there was actually great, despite their having to put up with all manner of craziness on the block.

The food is not bad here in the Mission/Bernal location, but the guy who is often at the cash register seems to hate taking orders and having to do basic arithmetic. I'd rather go somewhere else in the neighborhood, where I know I can end up with 1) the kind of burrito I ordered and 2) not a pocket full of odd change.

excerpts: Simply the best burrito in San Francisco...hands down.
burrito.author: Rael E.
burrito.review: Simply the best burrito in San Francisco...hands down.

excerpts: One of my recent visits i ordered my daughter a regular burrito with cilantro and onions and no hot sause, what do they give me a big tortilla with just meat, cilantro and onions!!!!
WHAT????
My daughter was very disappointed.
I let it go
maybe it was a mistake,
YEAH RIGHT!
On another occasion my boyfriend  tries to order me a qusadilla suiza and they tell him they don't make those their!!!!!
ITS ON THE MENU!
when he gets to my job with what ever he could order, and he is eating his regular beef
burrito he finds out that their is only rice and salsa in it
THATS IT!!!
Words could not express how upset he was.
burrito.author: Ana M.
burrito.review: Let me just say that i have gone here in the past and they were pretty good BEFORE my 2 recent visits. One of my recent visits i ordered my daughter a regular burrito with cilantro and onions and no hot sause, what do they give me a big tortilla with just meat, cilantro and onions!!!! WHAT???? My daughter was very disappointed. I let it go maybe it was a mistake, YEAH RIGHT! On another occasion my boyfriend  tries to order me a qusadilla suiza and they tell him they don't make those their!!!!! ITS ON THE MENU! when he gets to my job with what ever he could order, and he is eating his regular beef burrito he finds out that their is only rice and salsa in it THATS IT!!!!  Words could not express how upset he was.

excerpts: I usually get the chorizo super burrito and every time, I die of happiness and go to burrito heaven.
It is so good!!
burrito.author: Jill E.
burrito.review:
Cancun has the best burritos I have ever had. Ever. 

I usually get the chorizo super burrito and every time, I die of happiness and go to burrito heaven. It is so good!! And also very cheap as far as good food goes in sf. 

As a California native with an obsession for burritos, I've tried quite a few. This is place is the best. Make your way to Cancun in the mission. You won't be disappointed.

excerpts: Veggie burrito was delicious, but I am suspect about the rice as well, my body wasn't happy
and I'm pretty sure there was chicken stock in it.
burrito.author: Jeff M.
burrito.review:
Veggie burrito was delicious, but I am suspect about the rice as well, my body wasn't happy and I'm pretty sure there was chicken stock in it. If that's a problem for you, stay away.

Service, blinding fast. Horchata available. Very genuine little taqueria.

excerpts: super burrito
I ordered here
actually was deliciously hot.
burrito.author: Brad R.
burrito.review:
Great drunk food, I know this because I've stumbled in here all lit up and gotten my grub on before.

Standard taqueria fare and tasty salsas.

The reason for the four stars though is because this place knows how to bring the heat.  I've ordered lots of super burritos from many different taquerias and taco trucks and I always request them extra spicy.  Seldom do I consider the burritos I get actually spicy, but the "extra spicy" carne asada super burrito I ordered here actually was deliciously hot.

excerpts: Burrito, yay!
Getting back to the bar and realizing it had a tiny bit of meat,  tons of rice and nothing else.
It was not super by any stretch.
burrito.author: Mike F.
burrito.review:
Burrito, yay! Getting back to the bar and realizing it had a tiny bit of meat,  tons of rice and nothing else. It was not super by any stretch. It was awful.

WTF has happened to this place?

excerpts: The burrito was different than most and very good.
Bathroom wasn't the cleanest, that would be my only complaint.
burrito.author: Dara R.
burrito.review: Very good authentic Mexican! Every order comes with chips and yummy guac and salsa. The burrito was different than most and very good. Bathroom wasn't the cleanest, that would be my only complaint.

excerpts: So I wouldn't really call that a "Super Burrito.
But all in all, that thing was gone in nothing flat!
I'd say worth your time if you find yourself hungry on mission st.
burrito.author: Taylor S.
burrito.review: Everyone hears about how unbeatable San Fran burritos are... So upon my first time being in SF, the first stop was here. The family that we're renting a home from a few streets up had suggested it and man were they spot on. Burritos tasted fresh, authentic, and were packed to the brim! My one bummer moment was seeing that they don't include cheese, lettuce or guac inside. So I wouldn't really call that a "Super Burrito." But all in all, that thing was gone in nothing flat! I'd say worth your time if you find yourself hungry on mission st.

excerpts: Had the carne asada burrito....
Delicious!!!!
Happy we stopped in!
burrito.author: Karin L.
burrito.review: Legit Mexican food! Had the carne asada burrito.... Delicious!!!! Happy we stopped in!

excerpts: burrito
I've had in the city, and
for just $5 that's a great deal.
It's an inexpensive spot to stop by before you head to El Rio or the Knockout for some drinks with friends.
burrito.author: Rachel W.
burrito.review:
The first time I came here was years ago and I had ordered a pork taco salad served in a fried tortilla shell. Oh my goodness it was delicious, I'm talking tunnel-vision delicious. 

Now years later I live in the area and you know what? It really is the best veggie burrito I've had in the city, and for just $5 that's a great deal. It's an inexpensive spot to stop by before you head to El Rio or the Knockout for some drinks with friends.

excerpts:
4 people
4 burritos
every single burrito was wrong
i ordered beef ... got chicken
cousin ordered no cheese.... got cheese
other cousin ordered no onions.... got onions
other cousin ordered refried beans... got pinto beans
not one burrito was correct
and it wasnt even busy
and it was FREEZING in there.

burrito.review:

excerpts: I get the burrito mojado with carnitas every time.
It's realllly good!
I am a sauce fiend and they give you TONS of it.
The burrito is HUGE, and it's cheap.
What more can you ask for?
burrito.author: Shae H.
burrito.review:
These burritos are awesome!  I get the burrito mojado with carnitas every time.  It's realllly good!  I am a sauce fiend and they give you TONS of it.  I recommend getting it to go, because you get more sauce that way.

The burrito is HUGE, and it's cheap.  What more can you ask for?

excerpts: A great place for a last call burrito!
Not sure I'd go here during the day time, but post-Makeout Room
Watched a guy pick a burrito off the floor piece by piece...
Five minutes later I noticed his burrito had disappeared...
burrito.author: Leigh W.
burrito.review:
A great place for a last call burrito! Not sure I'd go here during the day time, but post-Makeout Room it does the deed. 

Watched a guy pick a burrito off the floor piece by piece...

Five minutes later I noticed his burrito had disappeared...

*shudder*

Yes. Great for 2 AM.

excerpts: They put a tiny pinch of meat in by burrito.
I'm talking like,
and I know a good burrito-
This ain't it.
burrito.author: Dante S.
burrito.review:
You want the real thing go to LA TAQUERIA on Mission.  

The last three times I went to Taqueria Cancun in the last two years:

They put a tiny pinch of meat in by burrito.  I'm talking like, 1/4 cup of meat-No exaggeration.  

This last time I went, business was quiet.  They forgot about my order and I waited fifteen minutes before going up and saying "hey I ordered something".  Their response "huh, oh...sorry".

I'm done with this place.  I've lived in this hood for 12 years and I know a good burrito-This ain't it.

excerpts: Anyway, the super prawn burrito is to die for.
They really load that baby up with prawns-
it's chock full of the perfectly grilled, crunchy, plump crustaceans.
I love to cut the burrito in half
burrito.author: Amanda R.
burrito.review:
This Cancun location gets five stars for me- it's a little bigger, a little brighter and a lot cleaner than it's other locations.  It's also closer to my casa, which is nice for me (but what do you care?).

Anyway, the super prawn burrito is to die for.  They really load that baby up with prawns- it's chock full of the perfectly grilled, crunchy, plump crustaceans.  I love to cut the burrito in half so my first bite is gooey, creamy, hot, amazing.

Their carnitas super tacos are also amazing and a great deal.  A little over 2 bucks for a taco loaded with meat, crema and at least a quarter of an avocado.  The carnitas is so juicy and delicious.  With the complimentary fresh chips and a melon agua fresca, you're good to go.

I also LOVE the guacamole-esque salsa verde that comes with the chips, and their horchata is some of the best I've had (there's a little extra cardamom in there, or something).  

Mmmmm.  Salivating just thinking about it.

excerpts: The Shrimp Super burrito is ok, lots of shrimp
but it tasted a little fishy.
The chips are good, salsa and hot sauces are just eh.
I still heart another taqueria.
burrito.author: Karen T.
burrito.review: I've been here a few times because it's convenient to a friend's house. I've had their Super burritos, Chicken and today I had Shrimp. The Shrimp Super burrito is ok, lots of shrimp but it tasted a little fishy. The chips are good, salsa and hot sauces are just eh. I still heart another taqueria.

excerpts: Definitely one of my favorite burrito spots.
burrito.author: Hannah M.
burrito.review: Amazing vegetarian burritos...their rice is perfect and they are more than generous with their avocado portions (hard to come by). They also have really great chips, not too flimsy and lots of flavor. Definitely one of my favorite burrito spots.

excerpts:
3/5 you got here drunk...again

get a burrito.
burrito.author: Alvin D.
burrito.review:
3/5 you got here drunk...again

get a burrito. everything is pretty filling. cash only though =/

after a few bites, you'll have settled enough of your stomach to keep drinking! yay!

go next door for drunk bingo at the knockout.

excerpts: I usually get the carne asada super burrito to go, but if eating there the super quesadilla is fantastic.
It's grilled and chock full and gooey and absolutely delicious.
burrito.author: Chris P.
burrito.review: I go here often. They'd get 5 stars if the meat was a better cut, but otherwise very very good. I usually get the carne asada super burrito to go, but if eating there the super quesadilla is fantastic. It's grilled and chock full and gooey and absolutely delicious.

excerpts: Best Burrito and Nachos in town.
Actually, in state.
Actually, in the Country.
Never been disappointed, they have amazing Carne Asada, and the best Salsa Verde imaginable.
I wont say the staff is the kindest and most welcoming, but it is after all a Taqueria that sells you a 2 lb burrito for $5.
Great Tacos, Quesadillas and other items, but they specialize in their Burritos.
Just look at the wall to the right of the register, you'll see countless "San Francisco's best Burrito" certificates.
Also, unless you have a gargantuan appetite, you can usually save enough of your food for a second meal.
Great Horchata too.
burrito.author: Benjamin F.
burrito.review: Best Burrito and Nachos in town.  Actually, in state. Actually, in the Country. Never been disappointed, they have amazing Carne Asada, and the best Salsa Verde imaginable.  I wont say the staff is the kindest and most welcoming, but it is after all a Taqueria that sells you a 2 lb burrito for $5.  Great Tacos, Quesadillas and other items, but they specialize in their Burritos.  Just look at the wall to the right of the register, you'll see countless "San Francisco's best Burrito" certificates. Also, unless you have a gargantuan appetite, you can usually save enough of your food for a second meal.  Great Horchata too.

excerpts: This place has a pretty good burrito.
I had the Vegetarian Burrito and it was a big burrito, very good.
The chips and salsa are not good.
The chips are overly salty wholesale chips and the salsa comes in little cups that' makes it obvious it's not made in house.
Overall it's a good deal for this neighborhood with a burrito costing you $5.50.
burrito.author: Ryan M.
burrito.review: This place has a pretty good burrito. I had the Vegetarian Burrito and it was a big burrito, very good. The chips and salsa are not good. The chips are overly salty wholesale chips and the salsa comes in little cups that' makes it obvious it's not made in house. Overall it's a good deal for this neighborhood with a burrito costing you $5.50.

excerpts: BF had the burrito and he didn't finish it.
That's even sadder...
burrito.author: jeddie k.
burrito.review:
I don't know which one I went to.
And it wasn't because I was drunk.
I honestly don't remember which one I went to. And yes, I am too lazy to google map it. And I didn't know until know that there were more than one.
Usually, we go at night. AKA I can't see the surroundings very well. Usually its good. Sometimes the salsa is too spicy for my taste, but its usually passable and quite flavorful.
I decided I wanted to go out on a limb and get the taco salad. Apparently, MAYBE, from a different Cancun than I usually frequent. 
Blek.
Whichever one it was I went to, don't go to it. Not much flavor, or color, and it just looked sad. 
BF had the burrito and he didn't finish it. That's even sadder...

excerpts: Great for a cheap dinner with pals & definitely more than enough burrito for two.
burrito.author: Sara L.
burrito.review:
I'm hooked on their Vegetarian Burritos.

$5.46 with tax & they're huge!

Great for a cheap dinner with pals & definitely more than enough burrito for two. And chips & salsa come with every order.

Yum...

excerpts: I ordered a burrito with pollo asado and a taco de lengua.
My first bite of  lengua tasted old and tough.
Yuck.
I initially wanted to try the Sesos, and now I'm glad they didn't have any.
I can't even imagine what old brain tastes like.
After pushing the taco to the side, I started on the Burrito.
I couldn't find any meat in my burrito, until I was about half way down.
Where's the meat?!?
Where's the flavor?
burrito.author: Robin K.
burrito.review:
Before a visit to Naps tres for some bad karaoke, I was hankerin' for some mexican food. I was told by a local, to hit up taqueria cancun only a few steps up the street.

bleh, blah, bluh, just about sums up the experience.

I ordered a burrito with pollo asado and a taco de lengua. My first bite of  lengua tasted old and tough. Yuck. I initially wanted to try the Sesos, and now I'm glad they didn't have any. I can't even imagine what old brain tastes like. After pushing the taco to the side, I started on the Burrito. I couldn't find any meat in my burrito, until I was about half way down. Where's the meat?!?  Where's the flavor? Where's the Salsa?

I concur with Tom R. and agree that there are a lot of other places in the Mission that are way better.

excerpts: My strategy is to call ahead - "pickup five minutes" - walk the dog over (approx five minutes), retrieve my freshly made tacos/burrito/breakfast burrito, and stroll home to feast in front of Seinfeld reruns.
burrito.author: matt s.
burrito.review:
Here is the truth: Cancun is inconsistent. However, 4 out of 7 times you will enjoy a terrific Mexican meal. 2 out of 7 you'll have a good meal and 1 out of 7 you'll forget you had a meal. Those are excellent odds.

My strategy is to call ahead - "pickup five minutes" - walk the dog over (approx five minutes), retrieve my freshly made tacos/burrito/breakfast burrito, and stroll home to feast in front of Seinfeld reruns. About as wonderful an evening as they come.

SECRET TIP: Get the Mexican coffee. It is mindblowing and nobody knows about it. I'm drinking some now, which is why I'm writing this review.

excerpts: I got the veggie burrito with added jalapeños.
Was spicy and delectable.
I can only eat half
so it's great because my husband
and I both get a meal for around $6.
Plus, you can trot on over to El Rio with your nice, warm burrito and chill out!
burrito.author: Jennifer P.
burrito.review: I do not like Mission-style burritos. I thought I never would, but Taqueria Can-Cún has changed that opinion indefinitely! I got the veggie burrito with added jalapeños. Was spicy and delectable. I can only eat half so it's great because my husband and I both get a meal for around $6. Plus, you can trot on over to El Rio with your nice, warm burrito and chill out!

excerpts: This place is Solid, in terms that you get a Big Burrito, your quesadilla or your nachos, and it's what expected "a Huge Americano Hog Fest", which by no means is meant to sound as a derogatory statement in part of Taqueria Cancun.

However, yes here is the However/ Comma part of the review, their food just doesn't have that magic SAZON (spice) that you crave when sinking your teeth into a giant mass of mexico wrapped into a flour tortilla.
I'm still trying to figure it out, let me get back to you with an updated review as I keep comparing it to others around the neighborhood.
I hope to uncover the missing ingredient for you.......
hmmmm
maybe it's the Lard/salt proportion that goes into the mix, who knows ,
like I said I'll get back to you on this hehehe.
burrito.author: Lannette G.
burrito.review: This place is Solid, in terms that you get a Big Burrito, your quesadilla or your nachos, and it's what expected "a Huge Americano Hog Fest", which by no means is meant to sound as a derogatory statement in part of Taqueria Cancun. However, yes here is the However/ Comma part of the review, their food just doesn't have that magic SAZON (spice) that you crave when sinking your teeth into a giant mass of mexico wrapped into a flour tortilla. I'm still trying to figure it out, let me get back to you with an updated review as I keep comparing it to others around the neighborhood. I hope to uncover the missing ingredient for you.......hmmmm maybe it's the Lard/salt proportion that goes into the mix, who knows , like I said I'll get back to you on this hehehe.

excerpts: I wandered over to Taqueria Cancun and tried a burrito with asada.
I was not impressed.
The burrito was rather dry, they put waaay too much rice, and the salsas were not anything special.
burrito.author: Jena R.
burrito.review:
Y'know after seeing all of those "Best Of" awards for Taqueria Cancun, I figured well jeeze I better check this place out, considering how much I love Mexican Food. 

Well after a visit to Cole Hardware I thought I'd peep the sitch. I wandered over to Taqueria Cancun and tried a burrito with asada. I was not impressed. The burrito was rather dry, they put waaay too much rice, and the salsas were not anything special.

I give this place 3 stars, because I'm nice. But hey, I hear the tacos are pretty good? So maybe I'll have to go back and return with an update.

excerpts:
so I couldn't round up to 4 (sorry)

Live here almost a year and my first mission burrito.
Back to the Burrito, Super (chicken)  no beans or rice - it was good.
Great flavor, salsa, sour cream, avocado and the perfect amount of kick (heat).
Great value
, place was fine, good service no complaints.
burrito.author: Jas S.
burrito.review:
3.49 so I couldn't round up to 4 (sorry)

Live here almost a year and my first mission burrito.  To be fair I don't like Mexican food (I know -- stop reading now and skip to the next review) but I was *really* hungry and wanted something fast and cheap, what are my choices in the mission?

Back to the Burrito, Super (chicken)  no beans or rice - it was good.  Great flavor, salsa, sour cream, avocado and the perfect amount of kick (heat).  Great value, place was fine, good service no complaints.

excerpts: Get the Burrito Mojado.
It's awesome.
Don't forget to bring cash, they don't take cards!
burrito.author: Travis S.
burrito.review: Get the Burrito Mojado.  It's awesome.  Don't forget to bring cash, they don't take cards!

excerpts: So I continued to order a Super Chicken Burrito.
I wanted a Strawberry fresca, but they only had Horchata & Cantelope,which I don't really like.
I waited like 5mins for food which is great.
The place seemed clean (minus the cockroach on the floor) lil
buddy probably wanted some food (HAHA).
Overall it was a mediocre experience I'm starting to think all these damn taquerias aren't as good as I thought.
Seems like bigger prices for not so great food and are catering to things like Veggie, which is great
burrito.author: Sarina I.
burrito.review:
Came here and I asked for pozole, in which I was looked upon like I asked for something that is never served. So I continued to order a Super Chicken Burrito. I wanted a Strawberry fresca, but they only had Horchata & Cantelope,which I don't really like. I waited like 5mins for food which is great. The place seemed clean (minus the cockroach on the floor) lil buddy probably wanted some food (HAHA). Overall it was a mediocre experience I'm starting to think all these damn taquerias aren't as good as I thought. Seems like bigger prices for not so great food and are catering to things like Veggie, which is great but hey don't forget about the authentic food.

Quick Tip: Cash Only

excerpts: Ordered the super prawns burrito as I usually do.
What I didn't know was that it also came with a bad case of the stomach flu.
Never coming here again.
Beware when ordering seafood here.
Save yourself the agony.
burrito.author: Cynthia Z.
burrito.review: Came here this past Sunday night. Ordered the super prawns burrito as I usually do. What I didn't know was that it also came with a bad case of the stomach flu. Never coming here again.  Beware when ordering seafood here. Save yourself the agony.

excerpts: This is hands down the best burrito in the city!
burrito.author: Amy M.
burrito.review:
This is hands down the best burrito in the city!

I am picky as hell when it comes to my Mexican food~ and this place is exactly what I want.  I *love* that they put actual avocado into my burrito- I don't really want guacamole~ I want avocado and it is like someone finally read my mind.

And the secondary factors... the chips are yummy, the people are nice, and the place is bright and cheerful!  I love how close it is to my fave dive bar and would never go to one without the other~

excerpts:
So of course I had to order a vegetarian burrito at Cancun.
I have to be honest with you, I was expecting more.
My disappointment might have to do with the fact that I had no cheese, sour cream or salsa in my burrito, so I had some brown rice with very little avocado however I did take a bite from my friends burrito and that one was so much better.
burrito.author: cecilia k.
burrito.review:
So in Sweden, tacos and burritos is not the most common food.
The tacos that we do have taste like plastic bag and tomato with some tasteless green "suppose to be guacamole" sauce, all I can say is that it taste like authentic Swedish shit.

So of course I had to order a vegetarian burrito at Cancun.
I have to be honest with you, I was expecting more.
My disappointment might have to do with the fact that I had no cheese, sour cream or salsa in my burrito, so I had some brown rice with very little avocado however I did take a bite from my friends burrito and that one was so much better.

I will have another try, maybe at the other spot.
All and all it was a OK place, the bread could have been a bit more toasted and I was disappointed that they missed my salsa.

excerpts: It gets four stars instead of 5 because I ordered a super taco and got a super burrito instead (which is what I was charged for).
I wasn't that hungry but still ate half the burrito.
And was sad the rest of the entire night for wasting the other half because it was so good.
Fresh ingredients and solid food.
Can't go wrong.
burrito.author: Jessica C.
burrito.review: Seriously the best taquria in the city.  It gets four stars instead of 5 because I ordered a super taco and got a super burrito instead (which is what I was charged for).  I wasn't that hungry but still ate half the burrito.  And was sad the rest of the entire night for wasting the other half because it was so good.  Fresh ingredients and solid food.  Can't go wrong.

excerpts: burrito, my roomie had the veggie, and other dude had the carnitas burrito.
The server brought them out after a short wait, and handed each to the wrong person.
I bit into the carnitas and was like "wow" this is great.
Veggie bit into my prawn, and my man bit into the veggie and exclaimed how good it was (and he is NOT a vegetarian).
I knew mine was not prawn, but I was almost not going to hand it over
it was so good.
The seasoning was yum, if not a tad too salty, but calmed down by the sour cream (and the Mexican Coca-Cola).
When we finally sorted it out, I enjoyed my prawn burrito, though I wished the seasoning on the shrimp was just a notch more like the carnitas.
I tasted my pal's veggie burrito
and it was quite hearty and tasty.
burrito.author: Jon L.
burrito.review:
My roomies and I strolled down to Mission to play taqueria roulette and pick something we hadn't tried before. On the fence between a Salvadoran pupuseria  or tradtional Mexican fare, we walked past Can-Cun. I'd seen it walking thru the neighborhood, and admit I was adverse to the glaring yellow and bright lights. But after checking the menu and prices decided to give it a go. 

I tried the prawn burrito, my roomie had the veggie, and other dude had the carnitas burrito. The server brought them out after a short wait, and handed each to the wrong person. I bit into the carnitas and was like "wow" this is great. Veggie bit into my prawn, and my man bit into the veggie and exclaimed how good it was (and he is NOT a vegetarian). I knew mine was not prawn, but I was almost not going to hand it over it was so good. The seasoning was yum, if not a tad too salty, but calmed down by the sour cream (and the Mexican Coca-Cola). When we finally sorted it out, I enjoyed my prawn burrito, though I wished the seasoning on the shrimp was just a notch more like the carnitas. I tasted my pal's veggie burrito and it was quite hearty and tasty.  All of our burritos had been toasted on the grill before and serving, so they had a nice hot toasty taste.

While I am sure there are equal or better places in the area, this was good inexpensive and fresh tasting. 

Chips are salty and clearly not home made. I think my favorite chips in the city are from Maya downtown on 2nd near Harrison.

excerpts: Best burrito in the city.
burrito.author: Yoni M.
burrito.review:
Best burrito in the city.  There's a reason they keep winning the Best in the Bay award.  

I'm not one to exaggerate but I'd step over my own mother for their El Pastor Super Nachos.  The super burritos are excellent, using big thick slices of real avocado.  One last note, the green sauce they serve with the free chips will change your life.  Colors will be brighter, birds will sing to you and rainbows will appear at random.  Damn I love acid.  

Bring cash because they don't do the card thing (Welcome to the Mission) and enjoy the comical, late-night hipster contingent  while waiting for your food.  You're always bound to hear a conversation laced with grand opinions and self-referential pomposity.
