excerpts: Because I like to get my burrito on in as zen a fashion as possible.
burrito.author: Autumn K.
burrito.review:
Just like Cancun down at Mission and 19th except minus the drunk hipster overflow from neighboring inner mission bars. Which is good. Because I like to get my burrito on in as zen a fashion as possible. 

Downside? If taqueria fare makes you gassy, you'll need to leg it out of there straight away. It's so quiet in here, everyone will know it was you.

excerpts: BEST SUPER BURRITO de Al Pastor by far.
For the longest La Tapatia in South City was my go to place for a burrito.

I was always let down by other places but one late night feening for a burrito I was brought into Taqueria Cancun and of course I went with the AL Pastor because honestly it's the best kind of meat that is just meant to be in a Super Burrito.
The pork is marinated so well and with hints of pineapple take this burrito over the top.
Be sure to ask for extra green salsa, pour that over each bite of the burrito, foodgasm each time.
Most places charge $10+ for a super burrito, here at Cancun the prices are fair and cheaper than most places.
Don't forget to grab an Agua Fresca, usually they have 2 flavors, Horchata and Melon.
Both are amazing.
Service is fast here.
I order over the phone and most times they say "okay ready in 5 mins.
Quickest service I've received other than a fast food place.
Definitely my #1 go to place for a super burrito.
burrito.author: Liza E.
burrito.review: BEST SUPER BURRITO de Al Pastor by far. For the longest La Tapatia in South City was my go to place for a burrito. I was always let down by other places but one late night feening for a burrito I was brought into Taqueria Cancun and of course I went with the AL Pastor because honestly it's the best kind of meat that is just meant to be in a Super Burrito. The pork is marinated so well and with hints of pineapple take this burrito over the top. Be sure to ask for extra green salsa, pour that over each bite of the burrito, foodgasm each time. Most places charge $10+ for a super burrito, here at Cancun the prices are fair and cheaper than most places. Don't forget to grab an Agua Fresca, usually they have 2 flavors, Horchata and Melon. Both are amazing. Service is fast here. I order over the phone and most times they say "okay ready in 5 mins." Quickest service I've received other than a fast food place. Definitely my #1 go to place for a super burrito.

excerpts: SO much better than the burrito and won't make you pop your pants' button.
burrito.author: Liz S.
burrito.review:
Post-drinking taqueria-munchies must be some kind of SF rite of passage.  You people who grew up here, you have no idea what shit we had to eat in the Midwest after a night of imbibing - with the exception of the Pork Burger Man at my college (bless that man!), it was slim pickings.  Doritos and Hostess donuts, or Taco Bell - ugggghhhh....Taquerias are the diners of the West Coast - they serve both the young and old, they are open all the time, and when you gotta have it, you gotta have it.  You know what I mean.

Everything on the menu is what you would expect, but I am going to tell you something VERY useful, here is the best item they offer:  1 Taco.

1 Taco.  It couldn't be more simple.  Or more delicious.

Get it with the carnitas (they must not have had them before, but they do now).  So savory and wonderful.  SO much better than the burrito and won't make you pop your pants' button.

It's so good that it almost makes the electric urine colored walls, the drunk teenagers talking on the phone, and the "is it a guy or is it a girl" people disappear.

Road map:  Argus.  Stool dancing.  Taqueria Cancun. 1 Taco.  Car dancing.  Home.  Bed.

excerpts: I can't resist a breakfast burrito anytime of day, especially after consuming a lot of drinks.
Service is good, lots of space and conveniently located near a bunch of bars too :)
burrito.author: Greg G.
burrito.review: I always love Cancun. I didn't realize there was one this far down though. It was a pleasant surprise to say the least. I can't resist a breakfast burrito anytime of day, especially after consuming a lot of drinks. Service is good, lots of space and conveniently located near a bunch of bars too :)

excerpts: Had a veggie burrito and husband had a torta.
Food tasted ok.
Salsa was HOT.
Self serve jalapenos were HOT.
Food inspection score card displaying 66%...not so HOT.
burrito.author: Caroline C.
burrito.review:
Not as good as I remember. I guess when you're 22 and broke this stuff tastes great! 

We came here before we headed over to the Rocket Dog Rescue benefit at El Rio. (BTW, I won one of those Kristina R. "Not Normal Yes Normal" t-shirts in the raffle!) 

Had a veggie burrito and husband had a torta. Food tasted ok. Salsa was HOT. Self serve jalapenos were HOT. Food inspection score card displaying 66%...not so HOT.

excerpts: Ever since I found this place, I've been getting the Burrito Mojado ever since.
Such a good burrito!
Also the salsa and guac is perfect while waiting for the MOJADO!!!!
burrito.author: Danny P.
burrito.review: Ever since I found this place, I've been getting the Burrito Mojado ever since. Such a good burrito! Also the salsa and guac is perfect while waiting for the MOJADO!!!!

excerpts: $4.50 al pastor burrito?
burrito.author: Rocco B.
burrito.review:
$4.50 al pastor burrito?

Check.

Enough food to make me feel like I'm gonna yack?

Check.

Meat choices that include beef head, tongue and brains?

Check.

I thought it was great, and I was only slightly buzzed.  The place smelled bad (as others point out), so do take out.  I'll give an update once this bad boy works its way through my system on my ski trip tomorrow.

Or is that TMI?

excerpts: I like the vegetarian burrito and nachos, with no sour cream.
This location seems quieter than the others, so that works for me too.
burrito.author: Seong P.
burrito.review: I like the vegetarian burrito and nachos, with no sour cream.  This location seems quieter than the others, so that works for me too.

excerpts: Only vegetarians like this place because apparently they put a ton of veggies in the veggie burrito, but even if that did appeal to me (which it most definitely does not)
then it wouldn't hide the fact that it's still a shitty burrito with funky-tasting rice and awful salsa.
burrito.author: Doctor L.
burrito.review:
This place sucks.

The salsa sucks.  The rice sucks.  The chips suck.

Only vegetarians like this place because apparently they put a ton of veggies in the veggie burrito, but even if that did appeal to me (which it most definitely does not) then it wouldn't hide the fact that it's still a shitty burrito with funky-tasting rice and awful salsa.

I can't understand how this place wins so many "readers' choice" awards because it just flat out fucking sucks.

excerpts: There's just no way they have the best burrito in the city.
Not a chance.
burrito.author: Abby W.
burrito.review:
Taqueria Cancun is pretty much my neighbor. This comes in very handy on the rare occasion that I am drunk and craving a  late-night quesadilla. The quesadillas rock, but everything else is just okay. I have come to love El Metate and totally prefer it over Cancun. 

There's just no way they have the best burrito in the city. Not a chance.

excerpts: However, and sorry all the hard fans, I do take Chipotle's vegetarian burrito over this one.
First, they do have the bowl which avoids you  the wrap; second, they are so simple and good
, it is just like a good salad with a beans base...
Anyways, there cannot be dispute when it comes to tastes, as Latins said, they are all good, depends on what you like better...
burrito.author: VIORICA C.
burrito.review:
Just checked out their vegetarian burritos, heard their names in the foodies news everywhere so I said to myself I cannot miss it...
Indeed, their food is good and the ambiance quite genuine. However, and sorry all the hard fans, I do take Chipotle's vegetarian burrito over this one.
First, they do have the bowl which avoids you  the wrap; second, they are so simple and good, it is just like a good salad with a beans base...
Anyways, there cannot be dispute when it comes to tastes, as Latins said, they are all good, depends on what you like better...

excerpts: This is my burrito and nachos standard in the city.
Carne Asada burrito comes heavy on toppings and lots of meat.
Usually get it to go, and eat it at home.
Hard to beat their flavorful burritos and spicy salsa.
burrito.author: Darren K.
burrito.review: This is my burrito and nachos standard in the city. Carne Asada burrito comes heavy on toppings and lots of meat. Usually get it to go, and eat it at home. Hard to beat their flavorful burritos and spicy salsa.

excerpts: I ordered a burrito mojado with carne asada and for $5.90 it seemed to have changed my attitude.
burrito.author: Valarie A.
burrito.review:
Taqueria Cancun saved my relationship last night!  No really, it did.

I was in a crappy mood.  I wanted to go to Whole Foods, but everyone and their brother were headed to the ballpark to see Barry.  I tried to buy groceries at Bi-Rite and it seems that all the non-ballpark goers were there. So, with my crap attitude I went home.  I wasn't up for my usual of GFC...and it dawned on me to go and have a cheap dinner and get out of the house.

I walked over to Taqueria Cancun and then realized how much cleaner this location is to the others.  How nice it is to not have the music blaring.  And an extra plus, no homeless people asking you for leftovers. 

I ordered a burrito mojado with carne asada and for $5.90 it seemed to have changed my attitude. Not only was it fast and delicious, but the price was right. 

Yes, I came home with a better attitude and a great dinner all for under $6.  Could you ask for anything better?

excerpts: To me it was just ok, the burrito overall was fine, wasnt too dry but the al pastor was average.
Their prices are also very low, the average taqueria in the city charges $7-10 for a super burrito.
burrito.author: Ian P.
burrito.review:
Ive been to this Taqueria Cancun a handful of times and its about average.  Their burritos are good but not great, they make a pretty good horchata and their prices are cheap. 

I went last night with a friend who is always raving about their al pastor burritos so I decided to try one.  To me it was just ok, the burrito overall was fine, wasnt too dry but the al pastor was average.  I felt that it was TOO marinated, the flavor of the meet was too strong that it drowned out the rest of the ingredients.

Other comments; they only use avocado and no guacamole, which is fine but I prefer guacamole. They do happen to have a really good horchata probably the 2nd best int he city behind the El Farolito in the Excelsior.  Their prices are also very low, the average taqueria in the city charges $7-10 for a super burrito.

All in all, this place was just ok. If I am with a group of people and they want to go here Ill go but if its my choice, Ill go to El Farolito.

excerpts: I second all these emotions...they make the best burrito in SF.
I highly recommend the carnitas-YUM YUM!
Don't miss out on a truly delicious and satisfying burrito.
burrito.author: Nick B.
burrito.review:
I second all these emotions...they make the best burrito in SF. I highly recommend the carnitas-YUM YUM! The lighting is a bit like a hospital waiting room but that just makes it easier to see the hombres caliente that work there. 

Don't miss out on a truly delicious and satisfying burrito.

excerpts: It's the size of a burrito.
Cancun doesn't mess around.
They remove the rice and beans filler that comes in a burrito and they fill it with sour cream, huge slices of avocado, meat, and cheese.
Too much good stuff.
I have brought over thirty friends here, and everyone of them has told me that it was the best quesadilla they've ever had in their lives.
No joke.
Don't waste your time with similiar resturants in the mission, I promise (and I've evaluated them)
, they don't compare.
Okay they come close, because who really cares when you're wasted?
Nevertheless, Cancun is open till 2am on weeknights, 3am on weekends, so it's there when you really need it
(eg: when you're drunk).
burrito.author: John M.
burrito.review:
Forget any other mexican joint in the mission. Here's why: you know you're at a great taqueria if the only types of salsa are HOT and "where's the flippin' water?" HOT. None of that v8 broth that other taquerias pass off as salsa

Get the horchata (you'll need it for salsa). Do yourself a favor and order the super quesadilla. It's the size of a burrito. Cancun doesn't mess around. They remove the rice and beans filler that comes in a burrito and they fill it with sour cream, huge slices of avocado, meat, and cheese. Too much good stuff. I have brought over thirty friends here, and everyone of them has told me that it was the best quesadilla they've ever had in their lives. No joke.

Don't waste your time with similiar resturants in the mission, I promise (and I've evaluated them), they don't compare. Okay they come close, because who really cares when you're wasted? Nevertheless, Cancun is open till 2am on weeknights, 3am on weekends, so it's there when you really need it (eg: when you're drunk).

excerpts: I don't think I've had a burrito from here...
I come here for tacos, and other joints for burritos.
burrito.author: L W.
burrito.review:
To start off, I would like to disclose that I have a rule to only leave reviews after patronizing a business at least 5 times so my reviews aren't made willy-nilly. 

Best tacos I've found so far in SF. 

Trick - get one super taco and one regular taco, as they usually put so much "super" on the taco, that it can be shared with a regular taco.  Or, if you're feeling naughty, just get two super tacos.   Quesadillas are pretty tasty too.  I don't think I've had a burrito from here...I come here for tacos, and other joints for burritos.

excerpts: The Mission location serves up a badass veggie burrito, but the taco I got here was pretty blah.
I do, however, love the slices of avocado used in lieu of guacamole because they add this buttery richness that is sometimes lost in guac.
Occasionally I'm into simplicity over complexity, and no, it's not
cuz I'm stupid.
I have my Master's, for christ's sake!
The amount of money I've spent on my education OBVIOUSLY points to my immense and intimidating intelligence, right?
Right?
Someone, please validate my choice to spend the rest of my life in debt!
Throw me a bone, people!
You know, I should probably just stick to the burrito.
Tastes better, which serves as good reason to eat more than a stupid taco, and I deem any reason to eat more as successful.
burrito.author: Chloe S.
burrito.review:
Eh. Perhaps it was the measly taco, but my last experience at Cancun was pretty unmemorable. And no, I wasn't drunk! Well, I wasn't THAT drunk, anyway. The Mission location serves up a badass veggie burrito, but the taco I got here was pretty blah. I do, however, love the slices of avocado used in lieu of guacamole because they add this buttery richness that is sometimes lost in guac. Occasionally I'm into simplicity over complexity, and no, it's not cuz I'm stupid. I have my Master's, for christ's sake! The amount of money I've spent on my education OBVIOUSLY points to my immense and intimidating intelligence, right? Right? Someone, please validate my choice to spend the rest of my life in debt! Throw me a bone, people! Or at least a dollar!

Anyway, Cancun's cheap, meaning that I can actually afford to eat here, and the salsa does meet my required level of spiciness. I would prefer an actual salsa bar, but the chips are so crappy that it doesn't matter that much.  Also, if you're looking for vegetarian nachos that will inevitably cause a heart attack, skip Cancun and make your way over to Farolito, trust me. Remember, I have my MA so I'm totally a credible source. Okay, someone needs to positively reinforce me RIGHT THE FUCK NOW. 

You know, I should probably just stick to the burrito. Tastes better, which serves as good reason to eat more than a stupid taco, and I deem any reason to eat more as successful.

excerpts: Best veggie burrito in the city.
Hands down.
I love the way they grill the burrito till the tortilla is lightly crispy.
burrito.author: Trey d.
burrito.review:
Best veggie burrito in the city.  Hands down.  I love the way they grill the burrito till the tortilla is lightly crispy.  Not to mention, even with the price increase they are one of the cheapest burritos in town.

Oh and the salsa verde is quite tasty with just enough heat.

Huge love for Cancun!

excerpts: Since moving to Oakland, I've had frequent cravings for Cancun's vegetarian burrito.
Soooo tasty.
I love the melty cheese, the guac, the whole beans...
burrito.author: Vandana M.
burrito.review:
When I'm bar-hopping in the Mission, I hit up the Cancun on 19th and Mission, but when I'm hoping to find parking, I go to the Bernal Heights location. Either way, I know I will leave full and happy. 

Since moving to Oakland, I've had frequent cravings for Cancun's vegetarian burrito. Soooo tasty. I love the melty cheese, the guac, the whole beans...it's just too good. 

Any East-Bayers wanna get together a Cancun Carpool, let me know!!

excerpts: I think what distinguishes this place from other burrito chutes in town is that the contents are not only fresh, but evenly distributed throughout the burrito and made with a consistent ratio.
There is always plenty of room to sit, and the water glasses are almost always clean.
burrito.author: Matt L.
burrito.review:
Burritos in this town is like religion. Everyone has an opinion and as soon as you open your mouth about yours, people either yawn in retort or want to ram their fist in it, so be careful what you say. The thing is, unless you get one of them new fangled California burritos with olives and arugula (lord have mercy on your soul) they really aren't that different other than 1) the care of the assembly 2) the relative freshness of the ingredients (look at how brown the lettuce is for any indication) and of course 3) the general safety of eating there (check out their health department certificate and police blotter). That said, I will stand firmly by the Burnal Cancun.

I have no idea what level of affiliation this location has with it's other namesakes, but there is no question that this is the best of the lot based on the above standards. Always go for the *grilled* chicken, and grab your own personal bottle of Cholula to smother every bite. I think what distinguishes this place from other burrito chutes in town is that the contents are not only fresh, but evenly distributed throughout the burrito and made with a consistent ratio. There is always plenty of room to sit, and the water glasses are almost always clean.

excerpts: Generally, if you ask for  a veggie burrito at TC, you get a humongous thing barely capable of consumption at one sitting.
If you add in a little meat, it's definitely a complete meal.
Also their chips are some of the better chips-to-go-with as I have had at SF taquerias.
I also like the agua frescas, esp.
the watermelon one.
If they could only conquer a small fly problem, they would be heads over heels above Pancho Villa's or some of the other Mission district places.
burrito.author: Mark L.
burrito.review:
For a taqueira, TC is one of the best in the city I think. Although you get less for atmosphere and dining conditions than some places, the quality of the food and the prices are actually very good. Generally, if you ask for  a veggie burrito at TC, you get a humongous thing barely capable of consumption at one sitting. If you add in a little meat, it's definitely a complete meal. Also their chips are some of the better chips-to-go-with as I have had at SF taquerias. I also like the agua frescas, esp. the watermelon one.
If they could only conquer a small fly problem, they would be heads over heels above Pancho Villa's or some of the other Mission district places.

excerpts: Simply the best burrito in the city.
I've lived here over 15 years now
and I've tried just about every taqueria in the mission (no small feat), but this is the place that keeps me coming back.
burrito.author: Bryce M.
burrito.review:
Simply the best burrito in the city.  I've lived here over 15 years now and I've tried just about every taqueria in the mission (no small feat), but this is the place that keeps me coming back.  I don't think there has been a month in the last 15 years that I haven't eaten here at least once. 

The meats are grilled fresh imediately before going into the tortilla, the rice and beans are nicely seasoned and would be a treat by themselves.  Avocado is a nice addition to anything and their salsas are the best I've ever had.  They even sell salsa by the cup so you can take it home or to your friend's party.  Your guests won't leave you any left over when the party's over - it's just that good. 

I didn't even mention the price yet. How can this food be so good and still so inexpensive? I don't know why, I'm just glad it is.

Taqueria Cancun is worth the trip from anywhere in the bay area.

excerpts: Even though it offers a good portion for an inexpensive price...their super burrito being roughly $5..which is good if you are broke and want your $5 to go a long way.
burrito.author: Catherine O.
burrito.review:
I don't understand why this place got so many Zagat reviews...

Even though it offers a good portion for an inexpensive price...their super burrito being roughly $5..which is good if you are broke and want your $5 to go a long way. ...but i still wouldn't pay for it. 

I've gave this place two shots, and I dont' think I will be visiting back, unless I absolutely have no where to eat at 12am.

The last time I got a super burrito= meat had way too much fat and the guacamole was all brown.

To top it off, I got to enjoy my food with the bleach scent filling up the restaurant.

excerpts: Order order, veggie burrito, no cheese, no sour cream, are your beans vegetarian, etc etc.

Sit down, across the table from my date (that was a date, right mister?), they call my number, I do some kind of embarrassing standing/falling motion that gets the burrito in my hands and onto the table which I once again find in front of me.
Bite: ohgodamazing.
Bite: ohholyshitbestthingever.
Why...whys my burrito on the floor?
Neither one of us could figure out how I had managed to drop my burrito on the floor--face down, my I add.
And now, here it comes: the testament to how great this burrito was.
Within moments, before we could even begin to truly debate it, the thing was back in my mouth.
burrito.author: Devin F.
burrito.review:
So, I have a story about this place ("Hey, Devin, do you have  a story about *every* place you review?" Maybe yes. Maybe no. Maybe fuck yourself.). 

There I was at the Knockout around 1:20a on some lovely weeknight, when BOOM it hit me: must. eat. now. Starvingstarving. No, stop talking interesting person, no I don't want a beer no I don't want to dance nonononononono we're leaving NOW musthaveburrito. This, um, happens to me a lot. Anyway, so I've just moved to the neighborhood, and am not yet terribly familiar with the local late night eats, so I had nothing in mind when we ventured out, leaving one darkness for another. Immediate right: oh god. Taqueria RIGHT THERE! Magnetized, I stumbled in, dumbstruck with our good luck. Order order, veggie burrito, no cheese, no sour cream, are your beans vegetarian, etc etc. Sit down, across the table from my date (that was a date, right mister?), they call my number, I do some kind of embarrassing standing/falling motion that gets the burrito in my hands and onto the table which I once again find in front of me. Bite: ohgodamazing. Bite: ohholyshitbestthingever. Several bites later:

Drop.

Wha?Wh-y?Wha---why is it down...what is? Why...whys my burrito on the floor? Neither one of us could figure out how I had managed to drop my burrito on the floor--face down, my I add. And now, here it comes: the testament to how great this burrito was. Within moments, before we could even begin to truly debate it, the thing was back in my mouth. I was back to making out with that same juicy-beany-guacy-pico-y surface that had been smooshed down onto the taqueria floor.

This was like, my....third? date with a guy I really liked. And I let him watch me do that. I love Taqueria Cancun.

excerpts: Cancun (on Mission and Valencia, yes they cross) reliably serves the best vegetarian burrito in San Francisco.
I've been coming there since 1997, and the only thing that changed are the prices (used to be $2.65 for a veggie burrito).
Vegetarian burrito with pinto beans, extra cilantro, extra avocado, and no sour cream.
burrito.author: A S.
burrito.review:
Cancun (on Mission and Valencia, yes they cross) reliably serves the best vegetarian burrito in San Francisco.  I've been coming there since 1997, and the only thing that changed are the prices (used to be $2.65 for a veggie burrito).

Here's the perfect recipe: Vegetarian burrito with pinto beans, extra cilantro, extra avocado, and no sour cream.

excerpts: So around my house, there are two burrito places
I frequent.
This place and El Gran Taco Loco (http://www.yelp.com/biz/el-gran-taco-loco-san-francisco).
But recently, I find myself coming here more often, which if you know me, walking an extra block to get a burrito is quite a statement.
I think it's because of the "Best Burrito Ev4r!
awards they proudly display, or some combination of the fast service and cheap prices.
I really don't know why, because their burritos don't taste all that special.
Anyways, nothing really special, but not bad either; right down the middle.
I guess that makes it my little Buddhist burrito shop (blasphemous, I know).
burrito.author: Zhi Q.
burrito.review:
So around my house, there are two burrito places I frequent.  This place and El Gran Taco Loco (http://www.yelp.com/biz/el-gran-taco-loco-san-francisco).  Taco Loco is literally right across the street from my house (I often look out my window to make sure they're still open).

But recently, I find myself coming here more often, which if you know me, walking an extra block to get a burrito is quite a statement.  I think it's because of the "Best Burrito Ev4r!" awards they proudly display, or some combination of the fast service and cheap prices.  I really don't know why, because their burritos don't taste all that special.  Anyways, nothing really special, but not bad either; right down the middle.  I guess that makes it my little Buddhist burrito shop (blasphemous, I know).

Oh, they're open late too, so that's a big plus.

excerpts: I actually got burrito-jacked at this joint once.
No shit.
I was sitting there minding my own business, halfway through an al pastor or something, when I decided to walk across the room and get a cup of water.
In the 30 seconds or so it took me to do this, some guy just walked in off the street, picked up my half-eaten burrito, and started to walk out the door with it.
That's my burrito!
, I yelled at him when I turned around from the water cooler.
BURRITO!!!
, I screamed, as all eyes in the room turned towards me.

The thief paused by the door for a second, took a quick glance over his shoulder, and set the burrito down on the nearest table, right in front of some other lucky patron who was finishing up his own order, and then just bolted.
You just got burrito-jacked!", she said, barely able to keep her shit together through the hysterics.
The guy behind the counter witnessed the entire episode, and offered to make me another burrito.
I turned it down though.
I really wasn't that hungry to begin with, and
I probably would've given the burrito thief the rest of my food if he'd just asked me.
burrito.author: Gopal R.
burrito.review:
I actually got burrito-jacked at this joint once.  No shit.  I was sitting there minding my own business, halfway through an al pastor or something, when I decided to walk across the room and get a cup of water.  In the 30 seconds or so it took me to do this, some guy just walked in off the street, picked up my half-eaten burrito, and started to walk out the door with it.

"Hey!  That's my burrito!", I yelled at him when I turned around from the water cooler.  He just kept going.

"HEY!  THAT'S MY FUCKING BURRITO!!!", I screamed, as all eyes in the room turned towards me.  The thief paused by the door for a second, took a quick glance over his shoulder, and set the burrito down on the nearest table, right in front of some other lucky patron who was finishing up his own order, and then just bolted.  

This one girl just laughed and laughed and laughed, like it was the funniest thing she'd ever seen.  "You just got burrito-jacked!", she said, barely able to keep her shit together through the hysterics.  Indeed I had.

The guy behind the counter witnessed the entire episode, and offered to make me another burrito.  I turned it down though.  I really wasn't that hungry to begin with, and I probably would've given the burrito thief the rest of my food if he'd just asked me.  That rip-and-run thing got my dander up, I guess.  

I left after that and went next door to watch Astral play some shoegaze rock at the Knockout.  

True story.

excerpts: So I came here looking to get the bad taste out of my mouth from the last burrito I had at El Toro.
Thankfully, this did the trick.
I was happy that the rice was moist, the pinto beans flavorful, and the carne asada smoky and delicious.
My only gripe was the green salsa given with the chips was spicy but not very tasty.
Also, the burrito leaked thru my brown paper bag, but that's SFs fault for banning plastic.
At $5 for a reg burrito, I'll def return.
My current fav burrito spot in SF.
burrito.author: Chantly S.
burrito.review: So I came here looking to get the bad taste out of my mouth from the last burrito I had at El Toro. Thankfully, this did the trick. I was happy that the rice was moist, the pinto beans flavorful, and the carne asada smoky and delicious. My only gripe was the green salsa given with the chips was spicy but not very tasty. Also, the burrito leaked thru my brown paper bag, but that's SFs fault for banning plastic. At $5 for a reg burrito, I'll def return. My current fav burrito spot in SF.

excerpts: I once got the burrito with meat and didn't think much of it as much as the vegetarian.
burrito.author: Anthony B.
burrito.review:
Solely for the vegetarian burritos!!!

You will not miss the meat in these burritos. Very simple yet very very good. Once again don't skimp and get it with everything and a large melon drink. That's all that needs to be said. I once got the burrito with meat and didn't think much of it as much as the vegetarian. 

By the way the best meat taco is down the street on 25th and Mission, my other review La Taqueria.

AB

excerpts: This is the nearest burrito place from my front door, and it's a pretty good taqueria at that.
Their veggie burrito is excellent (hope you like lots of avocado) and their al pastor is tasty.
No carnitas, but their carne asada is good.
They usually have tasty cantoloupe agua fresca.
burrito.author: David A.
burrito.review:
This is the nearest burrito place from my front door, and it's a pretty good taqueria at that.  Their veggie burrito is excellent (hope you like lots of avocado) and their al pastor is tasty.  No carnitas, but their carne asada is good.  They usually have tasty cantoloupe agua fresca.  I would say they're probably just as good as El Farolito.

The patented Cancun decor consists of insane BRIGHT YELLOW walls covered with weird paintings of bare-chested Aztek warriors striking action poses while cavorting with beautiful latina maidens, and lots of colorful streamers hanging from the ceiling.

excerpts: This is my favorite burrito in all of SF.
I get the pollo asado regular with a spinach tortilla, and it is consistently fresh tasting and very, very delicious.
burrito.author: Brent D.
burrito.review:
This is my favorite burrito in all of SF.  I get the pollo asado regular with a spinach tortilla, and it is consistently fresh tasting and very, very delicious.  Inexpensive, and an easy, filling meal.

I have only two small criticisms: the chips are always stale and don't taste very good, and that sometimes, the juke-box springs on blaring unbelievably loudly after complete silence for ten minutes (on or off, guys!)

excerpts: Yummy burrito, good tacos, and a great super quesadilla.
One of my faves.
burrito.author: Zak S.
burrito.review: Yummy burrito, good tacos, and a great super quesadilla. One of my faves.

excerpts: The veggie Super Burrito was awesome.
But the place smelled like ASS.
I mean, it seriously smelled like
somewhere there's a layer of something that has not been scraped off or degreased for a very long time.
It was empty in there.
Several people walked in, smelled the air and walked back out while I was eating.
I halfway didn't mind because the burrito was so good.
What can I say, I'm a hopeless burrito addict.
Yep, veggie super burrito still is *
excellent*.
Go figure.
I really love the generous amount of cilantro.
burrito.author: Eric O.
burrito.review:
Smell: Scary awful!

Food: Great!

My first visit to this Cancun location tonight.  The veggie Super Burrito was awesome.  But the place smelled like ASS.  I mean, it seriously smelled like somewhere there's a layer of something that has not been scraped off or degreased for a very long time.  It was empty in there.  Several people walked in, smelled the air and walked back out while I was eating.  I halfway didn't mind because the burrito was so good.  What can I say, I'm a hopeless burrito addict.

Update, months later: Yep, still smells like *ass* in there.  Yep, veggie super burrito still is *excellent*.  Go figure.  I really love the generous amount of cilantro.

excerpts: My favorite burrito in the Bay Area.
Flavorful rice and beans, big chunks of avocado, a big filling portion.
The other offerings here are great too - the quesdilla suisa, the al hambre meat plate, etc.
The guys who work the register are usually friendly.
I lived a block from this place for twelve years, and often got a burrito there once a week.
burrito.author: Adam C.
burrito.review: My favorite burrito in the Bay Area.  Flavorful rice and beans, big chunks of avocado, a big filling portion.  The other offerings here are great too - the quesdilla suisa, the al hambre meat plate, etc.  The guys who work the register are usually friendly.  I lived a block from this place for twelve years, and often got a burrito there once a week.

excerpts: I had a veggie burrito here
a while back, and dang, it was great.
Maybe I've been wandering the desert sub-par burritos too long, but I was impressed.
Mostly by the rice and beans, the rice was fluffy and bright bricky red with tasty zest and the beans were equally impressive.
As always great slabs of avocado and any cheese problems (there used to be some cheese problems) have now been solved.
They still grill the outside of your burrito better than any of their imitators and the green salsa is great (thought the red is abysmal).

thousands of visits over the past 5 years) that Cancun has made by belly churn, and I the more numerous times I've simply been bored with what I thought in my burrito arrogance was it's lackluster burrito.
burrito.author: Gustie L.
burrito.review:
I used to eat at this Cancun location about 3 times a week, dinner, lunch, breakfasts.  I thought it was okay then - but it was my taqueria so I kept going back.  Lately I've been forced to eat burritos in other parts of town, and this has restored my faith in Cancun.

I had a veggie burrito here a while back, and dang, it was great.  Maybe I've been wandering the desert sub-par burritos too long, but I was impressed.  Mostly by the rice and beans, the rice was fluffy and bright bricky red with tasty zest and the beans were equally impressive.  As always great slabs of avocado and any cheese problems (there used to be some cheese problems) have now been solved.  They still grill the outside of your burrito better than any of their imitators and the green salsa is great (thought the red is abysmal).

Still, I also remember the times (well three that I can remember - though to be fair that's out of literally hundreds, if not thousands of visits over the past 5 years) that Cancun has made by belly churn, and I the more numerous times I've simply been bored with what I thought in my burrito arrogance was it's lackluster burrito.

excerpts: This is my favorite cheap and abso-freakin-lutely delicious burrito dive.
I've been coming here since I was about 10 with my dad.
The decor is a little tacky and overly colorful, but frankly, it's the best burrito in the city.
Now, I haven't been all over the world tasting burritos, so
I'm sure there's a better place
SOMEWHERE out there.
But I haven't found it yet.
burrito.author: Mindy L.
burrito.review:
This is my favorite cheap and abso-freakin-lutely delicious burrito dive. I've been coming here since I was about 10 with my dad. And now I bring everybody here. 

The decor is a little tacky and overly colorful, but frankly, it's the best burrito in the city. Now, I haven't been all over the world tasting burritos, so I'm sure there's a better place SOMEWHERE out there. But I haven't found it yet. I am a die hard loyal Bernal Heights Taqueria Cancun fan. 

I don't order anything but burritos when I come here. And everybody I've ever taken has declared it either the best they've ever had, or bumps it right up near the top of their list.

YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED.

excerpts: but I would still seek out their veggie burrito with black beans, spinach tortilla and no sour cream ( my way) even if it was across town.
burrito.author: Michelle M.
burrito.review: I love Taqueria Cancun ! Okay, it helps that it's in my neighborhood but I would still seek out their veggie burrito with black beans, spinach tortilla and no sour cream ( my way) even if it was across town. I also love the enchilada plate, I'll order the grilled chicken enchiladas with whole beans on the side and extra avocado.  Mmm the enchilada sauce is delish !  To go or eat in it's service with a smile. As a friend in the neighborhood says, on a good day there's no better restaurant.

excerpts: Okay, so they've been voted as having the best veggie burrito in the city.
burrito.author: Sean G.
burrito.review:
Okay, so they've been voted as having the best veggie burrito in the city.  I think it's GOOD, but I wouldn't say it's THE BEST. 

The veggie burritos are filled with delicousness, including slices of avocado.

I've had the veggie tacos a few times - if you're a strict vegetarian, be careful! I've found pieces of chicken burried in the tacos...

excerpts: Out I often pop in here to fill that salty void in my soul with a regular chicken burrito, but the truth is, its just OK.
Pizza and Burrito joints near bars always tend to get better reviews because lets face, that shit is good when you are on a bender, but that skews the data.
burrito.author: Zac H.
burrito.review:
This place is OK. Honestly, I don't see why Cancun has such a crazy rep. The food is standard taqueria fare, but its not mind blowing. If I'm having a Hamm's at the Knock Out I often pop in here to fill that salty void in my soul with a regular chicken burrito, but the truth is, its just OK. Pizza and Burrito joints near bars always tend to get better reviews because lets face, that shit is good when you are on a bender, but that skews the data.

La Altena down the street (by Safeway), while spotty at times, has fresher ingredients and a shorter line.

excerpts:
My search is still on for the San Diego style California Burrito;
Carne Asada, melted cheese and french fries...
alas SD is a bit far to go for that.
burrito.author: Geordie E.
burrito.review:
A bit  disappointed with TC lately. Used to be my favorite for Carne Asada burritos, but something happened. The flavor is bland, something... perhaps the salsa lacks the punch it had. Perhaps it's just this location. Perhaps the location a little further down the Mission is better.

Their melon agua fresca is very good.

My search is still on for the San Diego style California Burrito;
Carne Asada, melted cheese and french fries... alas SD is a bit far to go for that.

excerpts: We had the veggie burrito and the super steak burrito, they were fantastic.
Loved the avocado not guacamole, loved the amount of cheese, the price(!)
and basically I'm very jealous of anyone who gets to go here regularly.
Friendly and quick service too.
burrito.author: Cath A.
burrito.review: This place was awesome, I wish I could go every week! We were visiting from the UK and were recommended to go here by a friend who lives in SF. We had the veggie burrito and the super steak burrito, they were fantastic. Loved the avocado not guacamole, loved the amount of cheese, the price(!) and basically I'm very jealous of anyone who gets to go here regularly. Friendly and quick service too.

excerpts: This burrito isn't quite as magical as El Farrolito, but it's pretty damn good.
burrito.author: Klevin D.
burrito.review: This burrito isn't quite as magical as El Farrolito, but it's pretty damn good.

excerpts: Let's not forget this place still serves a solid burrito for $5.
burrito.author: Jackson R.
burrito.review:
A year ago, I probably would have given this place four, maybe five stars.  Can't put my finger on exactly why, but they've lost some zip on their fastball.

Maybe I'm just getting older.

Let's not forget this place still serves a solid burrito for $5.

excerpts: The vegetarian super burrito is delicious.
I love that they use fresh avocado instead of guacamole.
They chips could be better (like not stale) but who can eat chips when you are eating a GIANT burrito!
Also, try the breakfast burrito.
My friends and I have made it tradition.
burrito.author: Bella T.
burrito.review:
Upon moving from New York City, I realized that the Mexican food I was eating there was CRAP!

I'm addicted to these burritos. I can't get enough. The vegetarian super burrito is delicious. I love that they use fresh avocado instead of guacamole. They chips could be better (like not stale) but who can eat chips when you are eating a GIANT burrito!

Also, try the breakfast burrito. My friends and I have made it tradition.

excerpts: I had a burrito here
and it was competent and hit the spot; slightly more lime-flavored perhaps even.
burrito.author: Mike S.
burrito.review: I don't mean to give just "passing grades" to any/all of the taqueria's i've been to in the Mission but it's merely because I pretty much like them all and it can be hard to differentiate them.  I had a burrito here and it was competent and hit the spot; slightly more lime-flavored perhaps even.

excerpts: I have not had the burrito yet- although I am a creature of habit-
I will try the burrito when someone else gets the nachos so that I can have both.
burrito.author: Rob C.
burrito.review:
If you have not had there nachos - man you have no idea what living or eating for that matter is.  

I remember chowing nachos at the 7-11 in my yute...dang good right?  Or the nachos at Taco Bravo in Cupertino before they shut it down...now in Fremont ...

Ok back to these guys...the beef the cheese some kind of mad concoction- I cant explain it but they get all of it infused together perfectly so that you never are sitting there going - there is no cheese on this chip.

I usually will drop the car for a car wash on Van Ness and walk over...the walk back to the car is prolly a good idea- I thinks.

I have not had the burrito yet- although I am a creature of habit- I will try the burrito when someone else gets the nachos so that I can have both.

Avoid the lines go on a weekday lunch...or sit next to your fave drunk stranger on a weekend night.  The picnic tables make for nice socializing while you look across at the drunks scarfing down burritos.

excerpts: This local mini-chain serves the best veggie burrito in town.
burrito.author: Scott L.
burrito.review:
This local mini-chain serves the best veggie burrito in town.

Since this location is near me, the large breakfast plates are a godsend on Saturdays.

Another must-try is the ceviche tostadas, they used to be a buck twenty five but have gone up a bit in recent years.

excerpts: trekked out here to try the super burrito, since foodspotting's scavenger hunt for the 2010 100 things to try before you die (Big eat SF) had it on the map.... happened to just check the list to grab the # for said burrito, and the super burrito they list is for somewhere else.
burrito.author: S V.
burrito.review:
funny story. trekked out here to try the super burrito, since foodspotting's scavenger hunt for the 2010 100 things to try before you die (Big eat SF) had it on the map.... happened to just check the list to grab the # for said burrito, and the super burrito they list is for somewhere else. oops.

that said, good hearty food for like 6 bucks (CASH ONLY). big enough for me to split and keep for another meal, yay cheapness! spicer than expected (had pollo asado) and wayyyy more rice than expected.

random note: i asked for a whole wheat tortilla but my friend got it on his burriot instead. oh well.

excerpts: Get the Al Pastor burrito.
Rocks the house.
I hear they have carnitas
so I'll have to try that, too.
burrito.author: Pete B.
burrito.review:
I can't believe all you crybabies whining about the atmosphere or the neighborhood. If you want Tony, stay in Pacific Heights where you belong. 

I can only imagine how much you whine about eateries in the Point or the Western Addition.

Folks, don't listen to the youthful morons with the sense of entitlement. This place ROCKS! Second only to Don Chuy's at Naples and Excelsior. The jukebox is GREAT, the chow is great, and if the young toughs keep the other kiddies away (it must be terrible to live in such fear of anyone  brown or black) that means there's more for the folks in the neighborhood. 

Get the Al Pastor burrito. Rocks the house. I hear they have carnitas so I'll have to try that, too.

excerpts: Also, I'm starting to think I need to skip on the cilantro when I get a burrito
but thats just me.
Really though, this was just a sub-average burrito, and the guy was a jerk (just like the guy at the Market one - is that a requirement for Taqueria Cancun?)
My hunt for the best veggie burrito in the Mission continues.....
At least this place has a working bathroom though.
burrito.author: Tmon B.
burrito.review:
I've had a few veggie burritos at the Market st. location and always been satisfied - maybe it was the 2:30 am-ness of this outer mission franchise, but I was sorely dissapointed.  Yes cheap, yes big, but NO FLAVOR.  Also, I'm starting to think I need to skip on the cilantro when I get a burrito but thats just me.  Really though, this was just a sub-average burrito, and the guy was a jerk (just like the guy at the Market one - is that a requirement for Taqueria Cancun?)

My hunt for the best veggie burrito in the Mission continues.....At least this place has a working bathroom though.

excerpts: I ordered the veggie burrito and so far its the best veggie burrito I've had.
Moderately spicy and a tasty sauce, not to mention that it was a gigantic burrito
and I was full and happy.
burrito.author: Rahul P.
burrito.review: I ordered the veggie burrito and so far its the best veggie burrito I've had. Moderately spicy and a tasty sauce, not to mention that it was a gigantic burrito and I was full and happy. :)

excerpts:
So, I am an enormously avid burrito connoisseur, and this specific Taqueria Cancun location is by far the best I have encountered for just such a hobby. 

I've tried most of the menu, although I will say that my personal favorites are the veggie burrito (that being that I am in no way a vegetarian), and the super tacos  al pastor. 

($4.88 for the aforementioned veggie burrito.)
burrito.author: Liz O.
burrito.review:
So, I am an enormously avid burrito connoisseur, and this specific Taqueria Cancun location is by far the best I have encountered for just such a hobby. 

I've tried most of the menu, although I will say that my personal favorites are the veggie burrito (that being that I am in no way a vegetarian), and the super tacos  al pastor. 

I used to live two blocks away from this place and due to time and financial restraints could only eat once a day. This taqueria was not only perfectly substantial, but extremely affordable. ($4.88 for the aforementioned veggie burrito.) Also, the portions are so huge that I rarely finished anything in one sitting and could refrigerate and re-heat at my whim.

My only criticisms of this place are typical of good Mexican establishments: it's a little lacking in the hygene department and the guys who work there really love the ladies, if you know what I mean. I will say, however, that one rather cheery fellow with a mustache and thick-rimmed black glasses is really cordial. Two thumbs up!

excerpts: Just ordered a Chicken Super Burrito and my carnal ordered a Carne Asada Super Burrito.
burrito.author: Alberto L.
burrito.review:
Just discovered another Taqueria today Sept 16th on Mexican Independence day. 

Just ordered a Chicken Super Burrito and my carnal ordered a Carne Asada Super Burrito. Pretty good

The menu looks promising

So far so good!

Update I have tasted the Torta and to be completely honest they are Horrible first they use a small currant bread bun (Torta buns are huge) and second they are not toasted as they should in the end they are soggy, so after eating here a second time the Burritos are still good but the Tortas suck A real Torta is huge well toasted and filling not small and soggy!!!!

excerpts: Absolutely the best burrito in the city that invented the modern burrito.
Pretty sure that makes it the best burrito in the world.
burrito.author: Tod G.
burrito.review: Absolutely the best burrito in the city that invented the modern burrito.  Pretty sure that makes it the best burrito in the world.

excerpts: If I was standing outside it, it didn't have a line, and I was craving a burrito right then
, I'd eat here (and this has happened multiple times -
it's right by my apartment).
That makes this 1-star rating odd, because usually it means "avoid like the plague".
However, I can think of a solid half a dozen burrito places I like better nearby, and probably another half a dozen I haven't tried.
The Cancun at around 17th and Mission is dramatically better as well.

This place never has many people in it, which lets you get in and out faster, however means the ingredients just aren't as fresh, yet the staff doesn't seem to make as solid a product as other places.
burrito.author: Zachary R.
burrito.review: If I was standing outside it, it didn't have a line, and I was craving a burrito right then, I'd eat here (and this has happened multiple times - it's right by my apartment).  That makes this 1-star rating odd, because usually it means "avoid like the plague".  However, I can think of a solid half a dozen burrito places I like better nearby, and probably another half a dozen I haven't tried.  The Cancun at around 17th and Mission is dramatically better as well.  This place never has many people in it, which lets you get in and out faster, however means the ingredients just aren't as fresh, yet the staff doesn't seem to make as solid a product as other places.

excerpts: I've been coming here since it opened, and the Veggie Burrito is super yummie.
burrito.author: G G.
burrito.review:
YUMMIE! I've been coming here since it opened, and the Veggie Burrito is super yummie. So are the super nachos. And their green salsa is to die for. 

But alas, I can't bear to eat here anymore. Ever since the Health Dept gave them a 66 on their inspection card, I'm way too creeped out.

excerpts: As a vegetarian, I have a hard time shying away from anywhere that boasts it has "the best vegetarian burrito in san franciscio" and while out and about in the mission/bernal heights tonight, I was excited to finally try this place out.
I wasn't all that hungry nor in a mood to spend money, so
although I wanted to try the burrito, I settled for a cheese quesadilla with avocado instead
(it came out to $4.07 - not a terrible price).
They gave me some chips which were pretty average then, pretty quickly, my quesadilla came out.
Up until this point I was a fan.
But after I first bit into the quesadilla, I began noticing little bits of beef throughout (and trust me, it was definitely beef), hidden between the tortilla's layers.
It probably wasn't intentional, but as a place that claims to have the best vegetarian burrito, I was sorely disappointed.
There's a slight chance I might consider going back for the burrito, but after tonight's experience, I wouldn't be surprised if even that isn't truly vegetarian.
burrito.author: Roxy B.
burrito.review: I'd probably give it 2.5 stars really, but anyways, here's why: I've wanted to go to this place for a while now. As a vegetarian, I have a hard time shying away from anywhere that boasts it has "the best vegetarian burrito in san franciscio" and while out and about in the mission/bernal heights tonight, I was excited to finally try this place out. I wasn't all that hungry nor in a mood to spend money, so although I wanted to try the burrito, I settled for a cheese quesadilla with avocado instead (it came out to $4.07 - not a terrible price). They gave me some chips which were pretty average then, pretty quickly, my quesadilla came out. Up until this point I was a fan. But after I first bit into the quesadilla, I began noticing little bits of beef throughout (and trust me, it was definitely beef), hidden between the tortilla's layers. It probably wasn't intentional, but as a place that claims to have the best vegetarian burrito, I was sorely disappointed. There's a slight chance I might consider going back for the burrito, but after tonight's experience, I wouldn't be surprised if even that isn't truly vegetarian.

excerpts: Favorites are the Super Nachos and Super burrito.
Only potential downside is that it's packed at times and is cash only (not a surprise for most small San Fran restaurants).
Highly recommended- midday or for a midnight snack.
burrito.author: Rachel G.
burrito.review: Easily the best Taqueria I've eaten at in San Francisco! I have to resist eating there most days. The food is delicious, cheap, and it is quick with take out. Favorites are the Super Nachos and Super burrito. Only potential downside is that it's packed at times and is cash only (not a surprise for most small San Fran restaurants). Highly recommended- midday or for a midnight snack.

excerpts: i like how they use real avocado for the veggie burrito.
the shrimp ceviche is a good alternative your normal taco or burrito.
busy late night spot.
burrito.author: Sheri N.
burrito.review: this is my favorite place for al pastor!  i like how they use real avocado for the veggie burrito. the shrimp ceviche is a good alternative your normal taco or burrito.  busy late night spot.

excerpts: and they don't have carnitas, my number one favorite burrito stuffer.
In a pinch, it'll do.
burrito.author: Maria D.
burrito.review: My feelings on Cancun are mixed. On the one hand, they use avocado instead of guac in their burritos, have grilled chicken instead of shredded chicken and grill their tortillas. On the other hand, their chips come from costco,  their salsa is so hot that it's almost unedible and they don't have carnitas, my number one favorite burrito stuffer.  In a pinch, it'll do.

excerpts: At the other location I had the al pastor super burrito (thanks to Wakako.
Hi Wakako!!)
burrito.author: Jen D.
burrito.review:
blah blah blahbity blah... this place is just blah in comparison to the other Mission location. 

At this location I had the al pastor super quesadilla. It was good, but it was not great. 

At the other location I had the al pastor super burrito (thanks to Wakako. Hi Wakako!!) and that thing was mouth watering good. 

But having lunch with Eugy is always a pleasure. Thanks babe!

This place is CASH ONLY. But there is an ATM right next to the cash register.

excerpts: Quite possibly the best burrito I have ever had.
It had nothing to do with the fact that I had been drinking at El Rio for 3 hours, or that my friend went and got it so that I could keep drinking.
No.

It had to do with the perfectly marinaded meat, the spicy yummy salsa and the sour cream that was evenly spread throughout the whole burrito and the fact that I could not finish the whole thing and ended up giving it to the guy sitting next to me and making out with him for 20 minutes.
Yes.
The burrito was THAT good.
I'd totally send someone out to pick another one up for me.
burrito.author: Brenda K.
burrito.review: Quite possibly the best burrito I have ever had. It had nothing to do with the fact that I had been drinking at El Rio for 3 hours, or that my friend went and got it so that I could keep drinking. No. It had to do with the perfectly marinaded meat, the spicy yummy salsa and the sour cream that was evenly spread throughout the whole burrito and the fact that I could not finish the whole thing and ended up giving it to the guy sitting next to me and making out with him for 20 minutes. Yes. The burrito was THAT good. I'd totally send someone out to pick another one up for me.

excerpts: This is the best Burrito Al Pastor I have ever eaten.
I have gone back three times and I still love it.
You can taste the carmelized onions.
It is so rich and filling that I only need the regular size and I am totally filled and extremely happy.
And the cantelope agua fresca adds to a wonderful experience.
burrito.author: Nikki S.
burrito.review: This is the best Burrito Al Pastor I have ever eaten.  I have gone back three times and I still love it.  You can taste the carmelized onions.  It is so rich and filling that I only need the regular size and I am totally filled and extremely happy.  And the cantelope agua fresca adds to a wonderful experience.

excerpts: A great place to enjoy a cheap and easy vegetarian burrito.
The aquacate salsa isn't fermenting here as it frequently is at the Mission St. location.
burrito.author: Rajeev S.
burrito.review: My favorite of the three Taqueria Cancun locations in SF!  More spacious and less trafficked than the other locations.  A great place to enjoy a cheap and easy vegetarian burrito.  The aquacate salsa isn't fermenting here as it frequently is at the Mission St. location.

excerpts: but the veggie burrito is just so damn good that i didn't even miss having chicken.
burrito.author: Sidney B.
burrito.review:
few salsas rival cancun's. they both have kick and they're not runny. f'n awesome. i used to live a block away and ate here much more than i'd care to admit. but c'mon, a MEAL for $4.... are you kidding me?! god i love the mission. 

i did usually get veggie options there. if i did get a meat, it was steak. they use both white and dark meat chicken (mostly dark) and i loathe dark meat so that's the only drag about the place. but the veggie burrito is just so damn good that i didn't even miss having chicken.

the horchata is good, especially when it's fresh. and i can't say enough about the salsas.

excerpts: I always order a grilled chicken burrito because you can never go wrong.
No sour cream and with black beans.
This location is better then the one on Market street because it is kinda scary down there with all of those hobos.
The burrito came with free chips and a lot of salsa which I like!
or which I LOVE!!
But the burrito came with very little chicken which kinda sucks because in other places they LOAD of the chicken!!!
I was kind of disappointed.
They have a lot of awards on their wall!
Yeah this place do look very clean!!
I would come here again if I would venture here.
burrito.author: Janet Z.
burrito.review: I always order a grilled chicken burrito because you can never go wrong. No sour cream and with black beans. This location is better then the one on Market street because it is kinda scary down there with all of those hobos. The burrito came with free chips and a lot of salsa which I like!  or which I LOVE!! But the burrito came with very little chicken which kinda sucks because in other places they LOAD of the chicken!!! I was kind of disappointed. They have a lot of awards on their wall! Yeah this place do look very clean!! I would come here again if I would venture here.

excerpts: I felt as though a little piece of me died last night as I ate my burrito

Under the fluorescent lighting that cast a yellow aura to the
 already yellow on yellow dining room
My husband kept picking crunchy, tough pieces of chicken out of his mouth (he had the chicken tortas)
was my very first west coast burrito experience
(although for the life of me
I don't remember which location it was...oopsie)
this was more than a decade ago...
And I was forever changed

The burritos I ate during that summer in San Francisco were a large part of the reason I fell in love with the Bay Area
I have spoken so fondly of these burritos over the years
And that memory of the perfect burrito has always held an important place in my heart

So now I am older, and worldlier in the ways of the burrito
I did notice the last time I ate here (maybe 6 months ago)

That it didn't do it for me
I quickly made excuses...

I thought perhaps it was just that I was eating at 2:30 AM after way too many cocktails next door at the knockout
and quickly pushed the experience from my mind
recently upon learning
I would be going to a show at the Knockout
I was excited at the thought of going to Cancun
I was ready to rekindle the romance from my early 20's
However nothing tasted right
The rice was dull...

the beans flavorless, 
  the cheese and sour cream overwhelmed each bite (not in a complimentary way)
 and while the avocado was very visible- the taste of it was nowhere to be found
I think it's over between us now
But I will never forget that day I fell in love

burrito.review:

Under the fluorescent lighting that cast a yellow aura to the
 already yellow on yellow dining room
My husband kept picking crunchy, tough pieces of chicken out of his mouth (he had the chicken tortas)
