excerpts: since there are closer / better burrito places near where i live.
burrito there once.
burrito.author: Irvin S.
burrito.review:
not likely to ever come here again.  since there are closer / better burrito places near where i live.

there is a Cancun on 18th and mission too, had a good wet burrito there once. As well as el faralito on 24th and mission had a really good carne asada quesadilla suiza the other night (then I went home and threw up but i dont think it was cause of the quesadilla)

The health inspection score (green card) for this particular cancun shows a score of 66. SIXTY SIX!

is this even legal?  shouldnt this place be condemned?
Chaya on 18th and Valencia has a score of 88 and already that sounds low.  Burger Joint has a score of 95, but that place looks antiseptic almost.  I dont even know what the score represents, just that the higher the better.  So i imagine the score is made up something like this : start with 100 points subtract 1 point each for the # of boogers and rat poop found in or around the food prep area.  That's alot of boogers.

you know what? i hate burritos.   why do i live in the mission?  fock me.

** copied and pasted review  originally posted in the 18th/mission page

excerpts: Oh and I have had many a vegetarian friend get a littl meat surprise in their burrito.
burrito.author: Catherine D.
burrito.review: Just don't get the hype. Yes it's cheap & it fills you up but so do Ramen noodle. Oh and I have had many a vegetarian friend get a littl meat surprise in their burrito.

excerpts: The burrito, enchiladas, and other dishes are average for San Francisco.
On the plus side its open late.
burrito.author: BeeryMcGymrat X.
burrito.review: Best taco in the mission!  The burrito, enchiladas, and other dishes are average for San Francisco.  On the plus side its open late.

excerpts: And aside from LT's carne asada burrito, this Mission St. location of Taqueria Cancun gets my vote for everything else.
The al pastor burrito or quesadilla is to die for, and I usually do as I end up overeating.
The sauce is just delicious.
My son could literally eat their bean/cheese/avocado burrito three times a day if we would let him.
Hidden gem on the menu - the tostada de ceviche.
Super cheap and tasty.
Close your eyes and you would swear you were at Maya paying like five times as much.
burrito.author: Valerie W.
burrito.review: This is our local taqueria, within walking distance and all that.  We probably eat here approximately twice a week.  Personally, my very favorite place for carne asada burritos remains La Taqueria.  But that's a 15 minute walk and this is 5 minutes.  And aside from LT's carne asada burrito, this Mission St. location of Taqueria Cancun gets my vote for everything else.  The al pastor burrito or quesadilla is to die for, and I usually do as I end up overeating.  The sauce is just delicious.  My son could literally eat their bean/cheese/avocado burrito three times a day if we would let him.  Hidden gem on the menu - the tostada de ceviche.  Super cheap and tasty.  Close your eyes and you would swear you were at Maya paying like five times as much.

excerpts: Just go down the street to the other location and eat the best burrito of your life!
burrito.author: Anna W.
burrito.review: Not as good as the Cancun at 19th and Mission.  That's really all you need to know.  Not enough cilantro, not enough avocado, the tortilla wasn't grilled the way it's supposed to be, you're not sitting on those awesome long wooden benches... Just go down the street to the other location and eat the best burrito of your life!

excerpts: they also carry the ever popular super burrito, which has come to be an integral part of whether or not i like a burrito joint.
i think this is the best burrito place in the mission hands down.
burrito.author: David D.
burrito.review:
the place san jose will just never compare to........

the food is absolutely great. and it's fast. and it's cheap. and they give you good chips and salsa while you wait. and they have Mexican music blasting in the background. and they have cool Mexican deco hanging from the ceiling. and they have beer.

they also carry the ever popular super burrito, which has come to be an integral part of whether or not i like a burrito joint. i think this is the best burrito place in the mission hands down.

excerpts: My go-to spot for a quick and easy veggie burrito (with everything).
Cheap, reliable, fast, open late.
Not as good as Papalote.
burrito.author: Dan M.
burrito.review: My go-to spot for a quick and easy veggie burrito (with everything). Cheap, reliable, fast, open late. Not as good as Papalote.

excerpts: This is the best burrito EVAR.
The only thing that comes close is the El Faralito carne asada burrito.
Luckily, being comprised of beef puts it out of the running for the chirizo burrito Nobel prize, so we won't have to make that tough call.
burrito.author: Gabe M.
burrito.review: If there was Nobel prize in the category of chirizo burritos, Taqueria Cancun would win easily. This is the best burrito EVAR. The only thing that comes close is the El Faralito carne asada burrito. Luckily, being comprised of beef puts it out of the running for the chirizo burrito Nobel prize, so we won't have to make that tough call.

excerpts: Best burrito I've had in ages.
And I eat my fair share.
One complaint would be how stingy they are with the salsa.
Their green salsa is very good, but they only give you one ramekin.
There is no salsa bar.
Chips are not homemade, either.
burrito.author: Nathan W.
burrito.review: Best burrito I've had in ages.  And I eat my fair share.  One complaint would be how stingy they are with the salsa.  Their green salsa is very good, but they only give you one ramekin.  There is no salsa bar.  Chips are not homemade, either.

excerpts: The Veggie Burrito is number one in the hood for a reason.
Get it
and you'll enjoy it, or I'll buy it.
I live up the street and if you time your email right, I'll pick up the tab, my man.
burrito.author: Turkey N.
burrito.review:
You know what? 5! Well, rounded up from 4.5 because of the obnoxious conversation you sort of listen in or out for in that particular neighborhood. If obsessive hairstylings and bulged pants are what your parents thought were cool, who knows, in the evening this place could be bothersome. If you couldn't care any less about atmosphere or ambiance, like myself for the most part, then go. And it is open nice and late for those of you with sleeping or partying disorders and orders. 

The Veggie Burrito is number one in the hood for a reason. Get it and you'll enjoy it, or I'll buy it. I live up the street and if you time your email right, I'll pick up the tab, my man. Certain stipulations may apply, offer ends pretty soon. 

I wish I knew a secret menu for this place. Do you know what I mean? - Freshly squeezed juice upon request, in any case.

excerpts: My friend almost started crying, her burrito was so awful.
But maybe it's because we really wanted to go to Blue Plate, and waited an hour until 6 when it was posted to open, but eventually called to find out they aren't open on Sundays...
burrito.author: Kimberly K.
burrito.review: Completely dissastisfying...even when starving.  My friend almost started crying, her burrito was so awful. But maybe it's because we really wanted to go to Blue Plate, and waited an hour until 6 when it was posted to open, but eventually called to find out they aren't open on Sundays...

excerpts: Burrito was fresh and tasty and portions are huge.
Truly a good value for the money.
The only reason I didn't give it a full 5 stars is because I still have a bit of San Diegan snobbery left in me in terms of authentic and excellent Mexican food.
However, for the San Francisco bay area, the food here really almost did remind me of home.
burrito.author: Stephen C.
burrito.review: Solid taqueria with fantastic food. Burrito was fresh and tasty and portions are huge. Truly a good value for the money. The only reason I didn't give it a full 5 stars is because I still have a bit of San Diegan snobbery left in me in terms of authentic and excellent Mexican food. However, for the San Francisco bay area, the food here really almost did remind me of home.

excerpts: The meat here has got a lot of carcass and junk, and the veggie burrito without cheese/dairy, comes with sour cream and chesse,
I mean was he "f-ing" with me?
Anyways, if I'm hungry enough, sure I'll eat here after the Knockout or El Rio, but Farolito, Castillo, or the Cancun on 19th/Mission are better, if you're still kinda sober and have taste buds.
burrito.author: EJ K.
burrito.review: Two stars, giving them the benefit of the doubt, that the guy at the counter was too spaced out, or he was just a jerk at midnight.  The meat here has got a lot of carcass and junk, and the veggie burrito without cheese/dairy, comes with sour cream and chesse, I mean was he "f-ing" with me?  Anyways, if I'm hungry enough, sure I'll eat here after the Knockout or El Rio, but Farolito, Castillo, or the Cancun on 19th/Mission are better, if you're still kinda sober and have taste buds.

excerpts: The food is good at all of them, but everything tastes worse on 6th St. LOVE the pollo asado burrito, and the green salsa too.
Tasty breakfasts also.
Cheap!
burrito.author: Jonny A.
burrito.review: The southern-most, being the cleanest, is my favorite, though the one at 19th has the best atmosphere. The food is good at all of them, but everything tastes worse on 6th St. LOVE the pollo asado burrito, and the green salsa too. Tasty breakfasts also. Cheap!

excerpts: The bright yellow-ness of Taqueria Cancun drew me in and despite all the signs blaring about how their veggie burrito is #1, I was feeling the meat.
I asked the nice guy working behind the counter what he recommended:  "I like the chicken".
Can't argue with that.
I ordered a super chicken burrito.
I really liked the two salsas that came with it, especially the creamy green one.
The chips WERE stale as many other yelpers have noted.
The burrito was good.
Loved the pieces of avocado, the beans, rice, cilantro parts.
The chicken was just okay.
The flavor was good but some of the pieces were the bad rubbery/chunky parts that shouldn't have made it into the burrito (only a couple).
All in all, a pretty good burrito.
Next time I'm in the neighborhood and craving a burrito
I'd go for the veggie one.
burrito.author: Raleigh S.
burrito.review:
Was walking on Mission and trying to decide what to eat for dinner.  The bright yellow-ness of Taqueria Cancun drew me in and despite all the signs blaring about how their veggie burrito is #1, I was feeling the meat.   I asked the nice guy working behind the counter what he recommended:  "I like the chicken".  Can't argue with that.  I ordered a super chicken burrito.  I really liked the two salsas that came with it, especially the creamy green one.  The chips WERE stale as many other yelpers have noted.  The burrito was good.  Loved the pieces of avocado, the beans, rice, cilantro parts.  The chicken was just okay.  The flavor was good but some of the pieces were the bad rubbery/chunky parts that shouldn't have made it into the burrito (only a couple).

All in all, a pretty good burrito.  Next time I'm in the neighborhood and craving a burrito I'd go for the veggie one.

excerpts: They get 4 Stars for the Chorizo Burrito.
I used to live around the corner, and  they'd let me bring my dog in.
I loved everyhting they made!
burrito.author: Gary B.
burrito.review: They get 4 Stars for the Chorizo Burrito. I used to live around the corner, and  they'd let me bring my dog in.  I loved everyhting they made!

excerpts: Carne asada is dull and rubbery, and the burrito are way too crammed with the overly oniony salsa.
A hint to serving chips and salsa: chips from a bag are not authentic, and don't taste good.
Keeping the salsa in the fridge where it absorbs all the other stale flavors is not a good idea.
Skip this one.
Go to La Cumbre, Pancho Villa, or El Toro.
La Corneta is awesome as well, and yes my pasty-faced friends, IT'S CLEAN.
burrito.author: Michael F.
burrito.review: After reading countless glowing reviews from the Guardian each year on this place, I finally tried it. I am now convinced that most people in SF have no clue on what constitutes good Mexican food. How many times have you heard some drunken Marinaite tell you that the restaurant has to be filthy to be good Mexican? Why? So you can get sick? This place is fairly dirty, bad score from Health Dept., but it's really the boring food. Carne asada is dull and rubbery, and the burrito are way too crammed with the overly oniony salsa. A hint to serving chips and salsa: chips from a bag are not authentic, and don't taste good. Keeping the salsa in the fridge where it absorbs all the other stale flavors is not a good idea. Skip this one. Go to La Cumbre, Pancho Villa, or El Toro. La Corneta is awesome as well, and yes my pasty-faced friends, IT'S CLEAN.

excerpts: It has its superb tacos, but if you want a less hectic, less noisy taco/burrito experience, consider walking several blocks up Mission to the Bernal Heights Cancun.
burrito.author: Dean E.
burrito.review:
"This is the ONLY Taqueria Cancun. Most San Franciscans only refer to the first one on "the mile" drag of Mission Street. People who think vegetarian burritos are legitimate. ;-)  In my opinion that location has always been a bit overrated, although I do enjoy their Alambres and the classic Ranchera jukebox. Nothing like Lola Beltran belting "Cuccurrucucu Paloma" or Vicente Fernandez wailing "Volver, Volver" to enhance the ambience of a casual Mexican meal. The Cancun closer to the Bernal Heights side of south Mission is vastly superior in food quality, cleanliness, and general atmosphere. Ideally flavor is the only thing that matters in a taqueria though, and I've never been disappointed by this location's goodies. You can forget about the Cancun on Market Street unless you need to drop in for convenience. Perhaps the issue is size. The less crowded the kitchen, the better the food seems to be in this chain. Let the masses go to the perfectly fine La Taqueria down the street. It has its superb tacos, but if you want a less hectic, less noisy taco/burrito experience, consider walking several blocks up Mission to the Bernal Heights Cancun. It's one of the "best kept secrets" of the area.

Yes, the chips suck. Oh well. The salsas are very good and the "entrees" are tacqueria-perfect."

excerpts: I got a burrito al pastor here yesterday.
Two hours later I had a terrible headache and felt like throwing up.
Stayed that way for hours.
My stomach hurt and I had a case of Montezuma's Revenge all night and this morning.
I'm trying to imagine what they did to the meat that would make me so sick.
Disgusting...
burrito.author: Rich D.
burrito.review: I got a burrito al pastor here yesterday. Two hours later I had a terrible headache and felt like throwing up. Stayed that way for hours. My stomach hurt and I had a case of Montezuma's Revenge all night and this morning. I'm trying to imagine what they did to the meat that would make me so sick. Disgusting...

excerpts: Cancun boasts that they have the best vegetarian burrito in the city.
This I will unequivocally refute: While the veggie is well-priced, it is substantially smaller than other burritos around town, and is mostly tortilla wrapped around itself a bunch of times.
It tastes just OK, but Castillito's (in the Loin) veggie is much larger and more delicious.
This place has a lot of hype surrounding it, I guess it is due to its location near a lot of bars.
Drunk people can't tell their ass from their elbow, let alone discern truly quality Taqueria food.
All that being said, Cancun is a fine place to get a quick dinner, but just fine.
burrito.author: Mr. G.
burrito.review: This place is alright, it has a great decor (gotta love how they pump that Mexican music all night), however the extraordinary really ends there.  The food is truly mediocre when compared to many other taqs in San Francisco.  I will concede that the prices are a little lower than many other Mexican joints, but the food is reduced in quality (by just a little).  Cancun boasts that they have the best vegetarian burrito in the city.  This I will unequivocally refute: While the veggie is well-priced, it is substantially smaller than other burritos around town, and is mostly tortilla wrapped around itself a bunch of times.  It tastes just OK, but Castillito's (in the Loin) veggie is much larger and more delicious.  This place has a lot of hype surrounding it, I guess it is due to its location near a lot of bars.  Drunk people can't tell their ass from their elbow, let alone discern truly quality Taqueria food.  All that being said, Cancun is a fine place to get a quick dinner, but just fine.

excerpts: so one evening i reluctantly passed up a burrito at el farolito to try it.
i wasn't happy and didn't go back.
years later when i moved to 94110, my wife convinced me to give it another go.
still didn't work for me.
people love, it but
for burritos i prefer other places.
burrito.author: jw b.
burrito.review: i don't know how many taquerias i have eaten at in SF.  super carne asada burritos are my thing.  back in the day, Cancun was winning best of the bay so one evening i reluctantly passed up a burrito at el farolito to try it.  i wasn't happy and didn't go back.  years later when i moved to 94110, my wife convinced me to give it another go.  still didn't work for me.  people love, it but for burritos i prefer other places.

excerpts: the burrito mojado was scrumptious though the meat was a tad dry.
the sauce was mole-esque and not in a bad way.
burrito.author: ray e.
burrito.review: since brisas was closed, the next best source of carne asada that the sweetie was having a hankering for was found at Taqueria Cancun. it's true, it's not the same as the one in lower Mission BUT i was happy to find a late-night place where i can get food served promptly and the peeps were super nice. the burrito mojado was scrumptious though the meat was a tad dry. the sauce was mole-esque and not in a bad way.

excerpts: easily my favorite burrito in the city.
burrito.author: Dan C.
burrito.review: if you want to try the amazingness that are cancun burritos go to this one, not the one at 19th and mission. this one is relaxed, cleaner and doesn't have bums. plus you can sit at your own table. always quick, always delicious. easily my favorite burrito in the city.

excerpts: This place is bad I gave it a try I ordered chicken enchiladas and they were the worst enchiladas I had and to top it off their orchata no words never going back there.
Last the prices on yelp are different
enchiladas.author: Leo G.
enchiladas.review: This place is bad I gave it a try I ordered chicken enchiladas and they were the worst enchiladas I had and to top it off their orchata no words never going back there. Last the prices on yelp are different

excerpts: I ordered the steak enchiladas for around $7 and was presented with an enormous plate (2 enchiladas, a mountain of rice, beans, sour cream etc.) plus four hot tortillas.
And they don't skimp on the complimentary chips and salsa (2 kinds).
Definitely coming back.
enchiladas.author: Kareem Y.
enchiladas.review: I love this place. Affordable, friendly service and the portions are big. I ordered the steak enchiladas for around $7 and was presented with an enormous plate (2 enchiladas, a mountain of rice, beans, sour cream etc.) plus four hot tortillas. And they don't skimp on the complimentary chips and salsa (2 kinds). Definitely coming back.

excerpts: I also love the enchilada plate, I'll order the grilled chicken enchiladas with whole beans on the side and extra avocado.
Mmm the enchilada sauce is delish !
To go or eat in it's service with a smile.
As a friend in the neighborhood says, on a good day there's no better restaurant.
enchiladas.author: Michelle M.
enchiladas.review: I love Taqueria Cancun ! Okay, it helps that it's in my neighborhood but I would still seek out their veggie burrito with black beans, spinach tortilla and no sour cream ( my way) even if it was across town. I also love the enchilada plate, I'll order the grilled chicken enchiladas with whole beans on the side and extra avocado.  Mmm the enchilada sauce is delish !  To go or eat in it's service with a smile. As a friend in the neighborhood says, on a good day there's no better restaurant.

excerpts: The burrito, enchiladas, and other dishes are average for San Francisco.
On the plus side its open late.
enchiladas.author: BeeryMcGymrat X.
enchiladas.review: Best taco in the mission!  The burrito, enchiladas, and other dishes are average for San Francisco.  On the plus side its open late.

excerpts: So if I limit my crappy chips intake, and fireball "guacamole" salsa intake, not get the carne asada, chorizo, beef quesadilla suiza or nachos from this place, I can actually walk out and think that this place is a-okay.
Quesadilla Suiza with Al Pastor and their Horchata.
quesadilla suiza.author: Faffy L.
quesadilla suiza.review:
2.5 stars, actually.

Taqueria Cancun is a prime example of what hype can do. Just check out the overall Yelp ratings of all 3 of their outposts:

1) 19th & Mission: At the Hipster epicenter of Mission: 4 stars
2) This location: At the outskirts of Hipville: 3.5 stars
3) 6th & Market: At crack cocaine central: 3 stars

So due to liquor induced hunger, I now have been to all three of these locations. Taking hype (lack thereof) out of the equation, there's no drastic difference in food quality, overall, it's barely reaching "all right." But, this location is waaay less crowded, and no scooby-doo extras (see my other TC review http://www.yelp.com/user_details_reviews_self?userid=e331pQV1I-SSnWw_w0PfMA&review_sort=time&review_filter=category&category_filter=mexican) in sight.

So if I limit my crappy chips intake, and fireball "guacamole" salsa intake, not get the carne asada, chorizo, beef quesadilla suiza or nachos from this place, I can actually walk out and think that this place is a-okay.

So what did I have here that was actually good? Quesadilla Suiza with Al Pastor and their Horchata.

excerpts: As well as el faralito on 24th and mission had a really good carne asada quesadilla suiza the other night
(then I went home and threw up
quesadilla suiza.author: Irvin S.
quesadilla suiza.review:
not likely to ever come here again.  since there are closer / better burrito places near where i live.

there is a Cancun on 18th and mission too, had a good wet burrito there once. As well as el faralito on 24th and mission had a really good carne asada quesadilla suiza the other night (then I went home and threw up but i dont think it was cause of the quesadilla)

The health inspection score (green card) for this particular cancun shows a score of 66. SIXTY SIX!

is this even legal?  shouldnt this place be condemned?
Chaya on 18th and Valencia has a score of 88 and already that sounds low.  Burger Joint has a score of 95, but that place looks antiseptic almost.  I dont even know what the score represents, just that the higher the better.  So i imagine the score is made up something like this : start with 100 points subtract 1 point each for the # of boogers and rat poop found in or around the food prep area.  That's alot of boogers.

you know what? i hate burritos.   why do i live in the mission?  fock me.

** copied and pasted review  originally posted in the 18th/mission page

excerpts: The quesadilla suiza seems better suited for 2am than breakfast.
quesadilla suiza.author: David R.
quesadilla suiza.review: The quesadilla suiza seems better suited for 2am than breakfast.

excerpts: So far, I've been here twice and ordered the chorizo super quesadilla both times.
My first time here was amazing...
Five stars, I was in awe.
The quesadilla was so big and delicious!
The second time, it took them nearly 20 minutes, and my quesadilla was barely warm.
I highly recommend getting a super quesadilla (and probably saving half of it) since the normal quesadilla barely has anything but cheese.
super quesadilla.author: Kimberly Y.
super quesadilla.review:
Hit and miss. So far, I've been here twice and ordered the chorizo super quesadilla both times. My first time here was amazing... Five stars, I was in awe. The quesadilla was so big and delicious! The second time, it took them nearly 20 minutes, and my quesadilla was barely warm. I highly recommend getting a super quesadilla (and probably saving half of it) since the normal quesadilla barely has anything but cheese.

The service is fine, willing to help you but not the friendliest. There are a bunch of tables you can sit at, but they could be cleaner... Price is great, and they give you some chips and salsa too! I'm not used to getting anything free at a less-than-$10 place!

excerpts: Super quesadilla was amazing, but more food than I would have guessed or could finish.
Oh, and the salsas they give you with your meal were pretty spicy to me.
Overall, good atmosphere for a Friday afternoon
and I liked the picnic style tables!
super quesadilla.author: A P.
super quesadilla.review: Super quesadilla was amazing, but more food than I would have guessed or could finish. Oh, and the salsas they give you with your meal were pretty spicy to me. Overall, good atmosphere for a Friday afternoon and I liked the picnic style tables!

excerpts: I usually get the carne asada super burrito to go, but if eating there the super quesadilla is fantastic.
It's grilled and chock full and gooey and absolutely delicious.
super quesadilla.author: Chris P.
super quesadilla.review: I go here often. They'd get 5 stars if the meat was a better cut, but otherwise very very good. I usually get the carne asada super burrito to go, but if eating there the super quesadilla is fantastic. It's grilled and chock full and gooey and absolutely delicious.

excerpts: Do yourself a favor and order the super quesadilla.
super quesadilla.author: John M.
super quesadilla.review:
Forget any other mexican joint in the mission. Here's why: you know you're at a great taqueria if the only types of salsa are HOT and "where's the flippin' water?" HOT. None of that v8 broth that other taquerias pass off as salsa

Get the horchata (you'll need it for salsa). Do yourself a favor and order the super quesadilla. It's the size of a burrito. Cancun doesn't mess around. They remove the rice and beans filler that comes in a burrito and they fill it with sour cream, huge slices of avocado, meat, and cheese. Too much good stuff. I have brought over thirty friends here, and everyone of them has told me that it was the best quesadilla they've ever had in their lives. No joke.

Don't waste your time with similiar resturants in the mission, I promise (and I've evaluated them), they don't compare. Okay they come close, because who really cares when you're wasted? Nevertheless, Cancun is open till 2am on weeknights, 3am on weekends, so it's there when you really need it (eg: when you're drunk).

excerpts: Yummy burrito, good tacos, and a great super quesadilla.
One of my faves.
super quesadilla.author: Zak S.
super quesadilla.review: Yummy burrito, good tacos, and a great super quesadilla. One of my faves.

excerpts: I just got out of a pretty serious relationship with a carne asada super quesadilla from Cancun and let me tell you something, I have never been with a more giving, caring, nurturing lover than that quesadilla.
On the coldest of nights and the darkest of days that quesadilla smothered my worries in hot melted cheese and illuminated my spirit with it's bright south of the border flavors.
You simply cant ask for much more.
If only, I didn't get all caught up in those fish tacos from Nicks.
It was one time, I was drunk.
I thought it didnt count if you were drunk...

super quesadilla.review:
I just got out of a pretty serious relationship with a carne asada super quesadilla from Cancun and let me tell you something, I have never been with a more giving, caring, nurturing lover than that quesadilla.  On the coldest of nights and the darkest of days that quesadilla smothered my worries in hot melted cheese and illuminated my spirit with it's bright south of the border flavors.

You simply cant ask for much more.  If only, I didn't get all caught up in those fish tacos from Nicks.  It was one time, I was drunk. I thought it didnt count if you were drunk...

excerpts: At this location I had the al pastor super quesadilla.
super quesadilla.author: Jen D.
super quesadilla.review:
blah blah blahbity blah... this place is just blah in comparison to the other Mission location. 

At this location I had the al pastor super quesadilla. It was good, but it was not great. 

At the other location I had the al pastor super burrito (thanks to Wakako. Hi Wakako!!) and that thing was mouth watering good. 

But having lunch with Eugy is always a pleasure. Thanks babe!

This place is CASH ONLY. But there is an ATM right next to the cash register.

excerpts: super quesadilla al pastor.
I don't need to add anything else....
super quesadilla.author: stephan c.
super quesadilla.review: super quesadilla al pastor. I don't need to add anything else....

excerpts: The super nachos with carnitas were filling and cheap!
I even took the extra home.
Would come back again.
super nachos.author: Jess N.
super nachos.review:
10/10 would recommend! The super nachos with carnitas were filling and cheap! I even took the extra home. Would come back again. It was great to have some great Mexican in San Francisco! 

My friend had the super burrito with chorizo which she said is also delicious! They also do a vegetarian burrito if that's your thing!

excerpts: We ordered the super nachos (sans sour cream) with carne asada.
super nachos.author: Jean K.
super nachos.review:
Came here on a nachos quest because a friend who used to live nearby swore the nachos were the best here. We ordered the super nachos (sans sour cream) with carne asada. Definitely feeds 4 people with normal appetites or 2 very hungry folks. 

The carne asada was browned deliciously. And the avocado was sliced and placed on top. However, we couldn't come to an agreement on the salsa (I liked it, my friend didn't). But the whole thing was let down by the quality of the chips which tasted bland. If they got nice thick salty chips then it would be a 4 star for sure.

excerpts: Jamie ordered the hefty $7.99 Super Nachos platter, an extravaganza of corn chips, melted cheese, refried beans, sour cream, guacamole and salsa with chunks of al pastor (marinated pork) and slices of avocado and jalapeno on top (see photo).
super nachos.author: Ed U.
super nachos.review:
OK, so how can two Taqueria Cancuns (...or would it be Taquerias Cancun) be so different? The one I've been to in my distant past is the grimy one that's still there at Sixth and Market. I get cold sweats thinking about how I ate there once and had a derelict yelling at me for not giving him some change. It was not a dining experience I ever wanted to repeat, and I sprint just a little faster every time I pass by it on the way home. 

So it was with trepidation that I suggested to Jamie W. that we go to the one in the Outer Mission after noticing that El Zocalo was closed (yet again!) Wow, what a difference a neighborhood makes...so bright, open and colorful with a conscientious server and lots of seating. The menu is full of bargain-priced food, enough to thrill a truckload of illegal migrant workers... IMMIGRACION!... IMMIGRACION!!

Or even an overweight Asian-American looking for a cheap meal. But is the food better than my memory of their sister operation? Oh yes. I ordered the $4.99 Carnitas Torta, melty goodness in a French roll with plenty of pork, cheese, refried beans, and avocado along with tomato, onion and sour cream (see photo). Because it was cheap (a bad excuse), I also ordered a simple $2.99 Quesadilla that used the same cheesy goodness (see photo). Delicious.

Jamie ordered the hefty $7.99 Super Nachos platter, an extravaganza of corn chips, melted cheese, refried beans, sour cream, guacamole and salsa with chunks of al pastor (marinated pork) and slices of avocado and jalapeno on top (see photo). Like I said, hefty... and awfully good. 

FOOD - 4 stars...really good Mexican on the cheap 
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...Surprise!... clean and spacious, especially on a weekday night 
SERVICE - 4 stars...certainly fast enough for my considerable appetite 
TOTAL - 4 stars...OK, the good sister lives in the Outer Mission and her evil twin lives off Sixth...got it?

excerpts: They charge for meat on super nachos now here.
It's 3 dollars more.
So super nachos is 7 bucks with no meat.
This place sucks now and the nachos aren't as good as they used to be.
Never coming back.
Epic fail cancun.
Super lame nachos.
10 for nachos.
super nachos.author: Bert D.
super nachos.review: They charge for meat on super nachos now here. It's 3 dollars more. So super nachos is 7 bucks with no meat. This place sucks now and the nachos aren't as good as they used to be. Never coming back. Epic fail cancun. Super lame nachos. 10 for nachos.

The super nachos are meh as well.
I ordered a lot, but had some of each.
super nachos.author: Stacy C.
super nachos.review: Meh, I've had better. The super burritos are kind of small. The super nachos not that super, the chip and others ratio isn't that even and the spice is overpowering (and I can handle my spices). The super nachos are meh as well. I ordered a lot, but had some of each.

excerpts: Super nachos are also great!
super nachos.author: NC B.
super nachos.review:
HANDS DOWN. BEST TAQUERIA IN TOWN.

I WILL MISS YOU DEARLY TAQUERIA CANCUN SINCE I MOVED TO EAST BAY.

Let me just say, their super beef quesadilla or any other type of quesadilla is absolutely delicious. From the quality of the tortilla itself, to the yummy carne asada, to the pieces of whole avocado versus putting gross and watery guacamole, to the way they wrap it with aluminum foil to keep it warm and soft. Absolutely delicious and quesadilla second to none.

Super nachos are also great! 

Their hours are also extremely accommodating!! ONLY TAQUERIA IN THE CITY OPEN TILL 2:45 AM DAILY! 

LOVE IT, ADORE IT, OBSESSED!

CONS: they do not accept credit cards. This is absolutely RIDICOULOUS because it is only a way to drive clientele who does not want to pay a $3 ATM fee and other $3 NON-BANK ATM fee away... It's really a shame cuz I was often forced to hit el Toro as I only had a crdit card on me and was lt willing to use their ATM :(

excerpts: just stumbled in on a late Wednesday night, happy anything was open, scanned the menu with my friend Alexx, turned to him and decisively said, "how bout we get the super nachos to split."  With meat?
yeah, with chorizo!
I know this seems like a bad idea at first, a misstep on an otherwise pleasant, lightly intoxicated Wednesday, but it just seemed like the right idea at the time.
One of those instances where at least 85% percent of the time its the wrong idea, but this time, well just this time it worked out; like instead of,
"oh that night was just going swimmingly until we ordered fricking chorizo on the super nachos.
What's great about super nachos is that it takes like all the supporting characters from Mexican food  and makes a fairly solid stand alone meal out of it.

Like typically if you tried this in any other genre of food, it would fail miserably; like oh, I'll take hamburger meat, pickles, onions and tomato and put on a tray, bake it, slap some ketchup....you get the idea, like a clown in the kitchen basically.
And yeah, nachos are kind of like low-brow bachelor food, but that's only if you make it at home in your microwave,
where as when you order it from a taqueria/restaurant it takes on a much classier appeal.
A few caveats about ordering the super nachos with chorizo after midnight on a weekday (a weekend you have plenty of time to recover).
One:
Ask for the sour cream on the side.
Don't get overconfident.

You know that sour cream can do damage at that hour, but what is worst, is that when they smother the nachos in it, it not only turns a layered platter of beauty into a soggy, sloppy mess, it always (at least for me) makes me kind of feel depressed after eating them.

The second caveat is:  don't be foolish and try eating this by yourself (again with the overconfidence), or don't try splitting it with someone who pecks at food like a bird or who's too interested in talking about themselves and loses sight of what is most immediate and important, which is tearing through some kick-ass super nachos.......
I mean c'mon people, you gotta live!
You could split this three ways and it would still carry its weight.
Godammit, I just made myself hungry.

super nachos.author: Yoni M.
super nachos.review:
Best burrito in the city.  There's a reason they keep winning the Best in the Bay award.  

I'm not one to exaggerate but I'd step over my own mother for their El Pastor Super Nachos.  The super burritos are excellent, using big thick slices of real avocado.  One last note, the green sauce they serve with the free chips will change your life.  Colors will be brighter, birds will sing to you and rainbows will appear at random.  Damn I love acid.  

Bring cash because they don't do the card thing (Welcome to the Mission) and enjoy the comical, late-night hipster contingent  while waiting for your food.  You're always bound to hear a conversation laced with grand opinions and self-referential pomposity.

excerpts: So are the super nachos.
super nachos.author: G G.
super nachos.review:
YUMMIE! I've been coming here since it opened, and the Veggie Burrito is super yummie. So are the super nachos. And their green salsa is to die for. 

But alas, I can't bear to eat here anymore. Ever since the Health Dept gave them a 66 on their inspection card, I'm way too creeped out.

excerpts: Favorites are the Super Nachos and Super burrito.
Only potential downside is that it's packed at times and is cash only (not a surprise for most small San Fran restaurants).
Highly recommended- midday or for a midnight snack.
super nachos.author: Rachel G.
super nachos.review: Easily the best Taqueria I've eaten at in San Francisco! I have to resist eating there most days. The food is delicious, cheap, and it is quick with take out. Favorites are the Super Nachos and Super burrito. Only potential downside is that it's packed at times and is cash only (not a surprise for most small San Fran restaurants). Highly recommended- midday or for a midnight snack.
